37001.name: SanQi
37001.description:
Players take turns to either add one of three colors of stone to the board or change the color of an existing stone to match its neighbors.

One player's goal is to create either a circle or a triangle of six stones of the same color. The other's is to create either a straight line or a triangle of six stones of the same color.

37002.name: Photonic Attack
37002.description:
The players take turns to "fire" "photons" (pieces of their color) into a 7×7 grid from any edge. A fired photon travels in a straight line until it reaches the opposite edge or another photon: then it stops, and any adjacent photons change color to match it.

The winner is the player who has more photons of their color on the board when no more moves can be made.

37003.name: Boolean Rithmomachia
37003.description:
This game was inspired by the medieval game Rithmomachy. But whereas in traditional Rithmomachy the pieces are labeled with natural numbers and captures are based on arithmetic progressions and geometric ratios, in Boolean Rithmomachy the pieces have binary nybbles 0000, 0001, ..., 1111 and captures are based on the logical operations AND, OR, XOR, NOT.

For good measure, the board has also been updated from two dimensions to three.

37004.name: Monopoly: Somerset Edition
37004.description: This version of Monopoly is based upon the English area of Somerset. Proposed landmark locations include St. Mary Magdalene Church and Wells Cathedral.

37005.name: EarthOpoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
boardgameversion: Late for the Sky Production Company edition
37005.description:
Earthopoly is an eco-friendly version of Monopoly by Cinncinati-based game manufacturer Late for the Sky suggested Ages 8 and up
All the paper is recyclable. The ink is vegetable oil-based ink. The game pieces are either made by nature or completely recyclable, and many are made locally. The outer wrapping is made from Earthfirst PLA film which is a bio-plastic.

The game uses carbon credits and clean air and recycling incentives to increase property values. In the first printing, the tokens are to include the following: a lima bean, a piece of corn, a piece of crystal from Arkansas, a walnut pyramid, a bamboo ring, a shell, and an extravagant Botswana stone called a Carnelian.

37006.description:
From the Introduction:
" Battle rages on between orcs and knights. Green and yellow mix into a chaotic melee and no-one knows which side will win this battle. Each player attempts to make his side victorious, orcs or knights.

Mage towers scattered on the battlefield are strategic objectives, and it soon appears that who controls the most towers will reap the seeds of victory. "

Orcs and Knight fight on the battlefield in a chaotic melee.
Each player tries to secure small areas of the battlefield, hoping to regroup and turn the battle to his advantage.

Once an area of the battlefield is completely surrounded by orcs and knights, a tally is made on each flank to determine who controls that area.

Fight for control of 7 towers using tiles that have both Orcs and Humans in the corners. Use your Power Tokens like Drummers, Leaders, Banners, and Shamans to increase your chances of victory on the field of battle. The first player to control 3 towers wins the day.

Batt'l K'haos has well-written rules and is easy to pick up and learn. It is on the lighter end of the game spectrum and plays in about 20 minutes.
37006.name: Fangs and Swords

37007.name: Course Cavalière
37007.description:
In this card and dice-free horse racing game, players place bets on the horses in the race based on their position in the final standings. On a player's turn, the player chooses actions by placing cubes in the move zone or in the exploit zone. Players seek to make the horses finish in the position secretly chosen. The race is in 12 segments.

Awards

2008 - Les Journées Ludiques de Québec - Public Prize

37008.description:
A dangerous cult has risen in Arkham! Meeting in secret, these heretics and madmen consort with dark powers and offer up sacrifices to the Ancient One, while hordes of vicious monsters descend on the the town. It’s up to a small band of investigators to infiltrate the cult and learn from these dark rituals, yet even the most pure-hearted may find himself corrupted in the process. Will their efforts be enough to stop the Ancient One from awakening, or will the investigators succumb, one by one, to the blasphemous seduction of its Herald, the Black Goat of the Woods?

The Black Goat of the Woods is a small expansion for the Arkham Horror board game, and is a part of the Arkham Horror Series. This expansion features 88 new Mythos cards, 9 new monster markers, 1 Herald Sheet, and 76 new Investigator cards including new items, new spells, and the dangerous lure of corruption…
37008.name: Arkham Horror: The Black Goat of the Woods Expansion

37009.name: Sour Grapes
37009.description:
Aim of the game:
To collect enough grapes (green tokens) to cover the card.

Each player has a card depicting grapes.
on each card there are 5 "sour grape" bad circles, only known to the owner.
Each player is given 12 tokens (grapes) to cover the 5 bad circles and 7 additional circles.

Player A takes one token from the player on his right and continue taken tokens from the other players until he takes a token which was placed in a bad "sour grape" circle. At this point the next player does the same operation, collecting tokens until s/he graps one that was a sour grape.
The winner is the player who completes his/her card first.

37010.name: The Dance Game
37010.description: From the instructions: The object of the game is to dance your way around the game board to receive a standing ovation. The first two sides of the board relate to dance class, side three is the dress rehearsal experience and the fourth side actually has you on the stage performing.

37011.name: Bible Tik Tak Toe
37011.description:
Bible Tik Tak Toe

"Answer Bible questions, learn Bible facts, and enjoy Tik Tak Toe fun!"

Designed for 2 players or 2 teams, this religion game features 6 large illustrated tic-tac-toe boards and 12 easy to handle tiles. Includes a 64 page question/answer booklet.

Ages 8 - 12

(c)1994 Standard Publishing

28-02654

37012.name: The Outdoorsman Game
37012.description: Background from the instructions: The OUTDOORSMAN GAME was created by avid sportsman in a sparsely populated, wildlife rich area of Eastern Oregon. When he discovered that many of his junior high math students shared his enthusiasm for outdoor activities, he came up with a way to make statistics and probability more interesting to them. Drawing on his own experiences afield and information from fish and game departments, he developed a game that would involve fishing and hunting while teaching certain mathematical concepts. When people kept insisting that the game was too much fun to confine to the classroom, the idea was born of developing an activity that would challenge and entertain sportsmen when time, weather, or resources prohibited an excursion afield. The OUTDOORSMAN GAME is the result of those efforts. In the game, the species of fish, fowl, and big game, and the seasons and areas in which they are pursued, closely follow the actual events as they occur in Eastern Oregon. We trust you will find the OUTDOORSMAN GAME to an enjoyable and entertaining activity.

37013.name: Fotbollsspelet
37013.description:
Swedish trivia game with questions about football (soccer).

Before the game starts a referee is chosen. The referee reads the questions and keeps track of the score.

The questions come in 4 categories : Geography, Players, History and Misc. On a players turn a die is rolled to choose category:

1: Geography
2: Misc
3: Players
4: History
5: the Referee chooses a category
6: the player chooses a category

The first player to reach a certain score (agreed on before the game) is the winner.

37014.description: Auf Entdeckungstour is a movement & memory game for children Ages 5 and up A player draws a hidden card with one of the 18 different images on the wooden board. The opponents try to lock up the correct image on the board while moving the Findus figure for a number of fields after each other. After a move, the card owner tells the next player the right direction to the correct image.
37014.name: Pettersson und Findus: Auf Entdeckungstour

37015.description:
From the publisher's website:
Two parsecs out from Void Station 57, the Abaddon/Sheol binary system spins through the stygian darkness. The twin planets would be lifeless ice-rocks if not for the Dark Star Containment facility for the criminally incorrigible.

The Terran Bureau of Investigation has traced a deadly new street drug to the facility. As contract investigators, you must resolve the situation as quickly as possible. However, your investigation only scratches the surface of a far greater menace.

---

The Dark Star Incident is a programmed adventure using Dark City Games Legends of Time and Space rule set. These rules provide game play very similar to that of Melee and Wizard from Metagaming.

Battles are fought with counters on a hex map that is included with the game.
37015.name: Legends of Time and Space: The Dark Star Incident

37016.name: The Masquerade Game
37016.description:
"This new and pleasing game is composed of thirty-two cards, each representing a character in masquerade attire, and the whole forging such a collection as may be seen at the carnivals yearly held in Rome or Venice."

The winner is the first player to score thirty-two points. Publication date is approximate.

37017.name: The Reward of Merit
37017.description:
"The Reward of Merit; a new, moral, and entertaining game"

A race game in the spirit of Game of Goose. The game board has 37 illustrated spaces, each of which is marked with a rhyming moral. Examples include: "A Gardener; Plant what is good, root out what's bad; Then You'll become a charming Lad", "a Dunce; Return great Dunce, with marks of Shame; Unto the Place from whence you came", and "a Puppy; You're pert to all, yet nothing know; Therefore pay one, sweet-scented Beau."

37018.name: The Game of Kings
37018.description: An antique card game consisting of a deck of 38 cards, a sixteen page instruction booklet, and a red slipcase bearing a picture of King William II. The game is described as comprising "a brief history of the English monarchs, from the Conquest to the present time, with an engraved figure of each." The instruction booklet summarizes each monarch's reign.

37019.name: The New World Game of American History
37019.description:
"The New World: A game of American history from discovery to James K. Polk."

This antique card game consisted of a set of forty cards in a slipcase. Twenty of the cards depict famous people in American history with clues to their identity. The other twenty cards contain questions and answers about the original colonies and the first eleven presidents. The object of the game is to match corresponding cards from the two sets.

The game also includes an advertising card listing other games available from Josiah Adams.

37020.name: History of Philadelphia
37020.description: This antique card game contains sixty cards "with labels of five different shapes and four different colors." Each card gives information about a place in Philadelphia or person related to Philadelphia. Game play involved matching cards of the same place or person. This is a revised version of the game, following the first edition published in 1831.

37021.name: Running the Blockade
37021.description:
"Two or more players provide themselves with Wooden Pins. The object in view is to run between the lines of the blockading squadron and to reach Wilmington, N.C."

The game that appears to have been produced in the Civil War period. The game board is a maze that leads to a number of illustrated spaces on the board. Some of the spaces depict Civil War ships. These spaces require a player arriving on that space to pay stakes. Other spaces represent hazards such as a Shark, Torpedo, or Reef, which require the payment of a fine. The first player to reach Wilmington collects all the stakes and fines paid during the game.

37022.name: Commandments and Beatitudes
37022.description: An educational trivia card game from the twenties or thirties. Each card has two questions on it referencing a specific Commandment or Beatitude. Each card is also marked with a value in credits. There are four different play and study variations given. Depending on the game variation selected, the object is to either acquire the most cards or cards worth the most total credits.

37023.name: Wolf & Sheep Game
37023.description:
An antique children's trick taking card game.

"Farmer Brown was looking out a window of his barn and saw the wolves after his sheep. He loaded his gun and a race began. The wolves chased the sheep, and Farmer Brown, who was also a great hunter, chased the wolves."

"'Wolf' is a most fascinating children's card game. It is played with twenty cards by two, three or four players."

37024.name: Bible ABC's
37024.description: A card game from the twenties or thirties. Each card is marked at the top with a letter of the alphabet followed by a list of persons, places, and things from the Bible which start with the same letter. A Biblical quotation is also included on the cards. The rules specify twelve different games and game variations for use with the cards, including one game for younger children that can't read the cards well.

37025.name: Bible Books
37025.description: A card game from the twenties or thirties based on the books of the Bible, from the Old Testament through the New Testament. Each card describes a specific book and contains a number of questions about it. The rules specify seven different games to be played with the cards.

37026.name: Bible Cities
37026.description: Game 3 of the Profitable Play series from Judson. A card game from the twenties or thirties. Consists of a custom deck of cards, each featuring a city from the Bible and related Biblical quotations. Rules are given for four different games, including games designed for younger children and children who cannot read. In addition, there are five suggested methods for using the cards for study.

37027.description:
High Crusade is a simple but challenging, set of fun science fiction wargames rules that are ideal for anyone looking to start wargaming using 15mm or 25mm SF figures or if you just want a quick simple game, that works.

High Crusade background is set in the Ion Age universe, designed by Alternative Armies, but they are flexible and simple enough to be tailored to any SF background.

They are now available on-line at;
http://www.blease.pwp.blueyonder.co.uk/WG.highcrusade.html
37027.name: High Crusade

37028.name: Toy Parade
37028.description:
"Toy Parade is a colorful, exciting game for pre-school kiddies, who need have no knowledge of numbers and counting; and an interesting game for older kiddies too."

A vintage "spin and move" children's game for 2, 3 or 4 young children. The spinner depicts toys that are also shown on the squares of the game board. After spinning the spinner, a player moves to the next square showing the toy that the spinner selected. There are also colored squares on the board which have special effects, such as causing backwards movement or the loss of a turn.

The winner is the first player to get all the way through the Toy Parade.

37029.name: The Great Galumphus
37029.description:
"The Great Galumphus, an amusing round game of cards."

An antique children's card game featuring a custom deck of cards marked only with colorful illustrations of fanciful animals and their unusual names. Some of these include the Painted Pooh Pooh, Puttyfaced Popcat, Hairless Hunkum, Long Eared Scootler, Spotted Snifflegrub, Lunar Lumpkin, Flying Umbratunk, and the Cissling Sand Snapper.

The design is credited to "Miss J. Veal" on the title card.

37030.name: Cleaver the Pit
37030.description:
Cleaver the Pit, Version 1.0 is a Miniatures Game sold as a limited run of saddle stitched 12 page book.

Players create characters that fight in an arena. The characters are represented by a series of stats from which to extrapolate combat. The stats are generated randomly. Combat is conducted through a series of dice rolls and counter rolls to determine if one character hits another. Armor, weapons and skills can effect the outcome of each dice roll. Once a hit is scored, damage is determined. Once a character has exhausted his life points, the character is dead. The player creates a character. The character enters the arena. The character fights until dead.

37031.name: Cranium Letter Line-Up
37031.description:
The game includes a deck of cards with a hint on one side, and a word or phrase to guess on the other. It has 6 letter dice, and a 5 minute timer.

You are all working together as a team against the timer.

Some cards are laid face down in the middle of the table. Each player takes a turn by rolling the dice and trying to get the other players to guess the word on the card by describing it using ONLY words that begin with the letters showing on the dice.

If all the cards are solved before the timer runs out, everyone wins!

37032.name: Osiron
37032.description:
Osiron is a game inspired by the graphic, the "Flower of Life". Each turn, players swap colored triangles in order to fill in a full circle on the board. The Designer, David Huffman, creates earthenware Osiron sets.

The gameboard is comprised of seven perfectly interlocked circles. Through this interlocking, twenty four concave triangle playing spaces emerge. Each of the seven interlocked circles contains six of these playing spaces.
There are twenty four playing pieces that correspond to the gameboard’s twenty four playing spaces. Twelve playing pieces are light colored for one player and twelve being dark for the other.

One player chooses the players’ colors, the other chooses who will move first. Players alternate taking turns exchanging playing pieces on the gameboard with one
another until the object of the game is achieved.

With six of their twelve playing pieces, the first player to fully occupy one of the gameboard’s seven circles before their opponent does is the winner.

37033.name: Games of Life
37033.description:
From the rules: "Games of Life, 'Count the Cost' Etc. and C.C. Lessons. Good as a book for youth and adults. Youth - learn while you play. Adults - play while you live."

A custom deck of cards with rules for six different games:

1. Count the Cost - "Trick taking game. For 2 or more. Best for 4." "One who accumulates most property wins."

2. Game of Life No. 1 - Trick taking game. "Win most LIFE cards, Nos. 5 to 9."

3. Game of Life No. 2 - "Object is to collect sets of four cards each containing the words GAME, LIFE, WORK, PLAY, LOVE, REST, READ."

4. Game of Life No. 3 - "Use only NAME cards like the old game of Authors."

5. C.C. Football Game - A trick taking game. "For 2 or 4 players." A football field marked on a sheet of paper - a heavy line is marked in the center and ten lines on each side of the field. Card play is used to move a button from the center toward the goal lines. Each goal scores 10 points, after which the button is returned to the center line.

6. Charity or Getting Rid of the Blues - "Teaching that 'it is better to give than receive.' Like the very old game of Give-away."

37034.name: Historical Loto
37034.description:
"A Highly Amusing and Instructive Round Game."

Historical Loto is a Bingo type game where the Loto cards have historical dates marked on them. Each date lists an associated event and reigning monarch. A set of numbered Tickets matching the dates and numbers on the cards are drawn from a bag by a Teller. A player holding a Loto card with a square having a matching date calls it out.

Each player receives a pool of 36 counters at the start of the game. Six counters are paid into a pool for each Loto card played. A player must pay two more counters to the pool any time an improper claim is made on a Ticket. The first player to fill up six squares on any one card claims the pool.

Jaques also published a version of the game with dates from French history.

37035.name: The National Gallery
37035.description:
An antique card game in which the players attempt to collect sets of picture cards belonging to particular artists. The deck includes an Index card for each artist which specifies how many cards are in that artist's set. The player who collects the most cards is the winner.

Alternate rules are included for a game in which one player, the "President", starts with all the Index cards and asks each of the players in turn for a card from a certain artist until all of the sets have been made up. The players win and lose counters from a pool during the course of the game. The player with the most counters at the end wins the game.

There were at least two versions of the game published - one for the "British school" of art and one for the "Dutch school."

37036.description:
From the package back: This expansion adds 10 new cards including a seventh character - Dr. Harter complete with a few extra first aid kits, love and hate cards and the infamous cannibalism card. You must have Lifeboat to play.

Expands:

Lifeboat
37036.name: Lifeboat Expansion #1: Cannibalism
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 46 - Lifeboat

37037.name: Double or Nothing
37037.description:
A card and dice game. 60 cards one die and rules of play. Ages 8 and up
Online support at SimaxGames.com and free game play (coming soon). Collect,steal,or swap cards to be the first to get to the number and win ! Roll the dice to steal cards or flip a card over and maybe double your points!

Not to be confused with "Double or Nothing" published the same year.

37038.name: Cannibal Eyes
37038.description:
An old legend tells of great warriors who ate their enemies’ eyes to acquire their power. Cannibal Eyes is built on this motif: the more eyes you collect, the more powerful you become.

Despite the cannibal theme, the game is very abstract. Moving your skulls and positioning their mouths next to the eyes of your opponents' skull you are able to eat their eyes.

The first player to seize and swallow four eyes is the winner.

37039.name: Lizard Lunch!
37039.description: Lizard's Lunch! is a children's action game. Each player takes a hand-held chameleon with a long sticky tongue. The players try to flick the tongue to grab shiny, plastic flies off of the table or ground. Whoever grabs the most wins. The game includes two chameleons and sixteen flies.

37040.name: The Great Chlén Race
37040.description:
"Chlén! The six-legged beast of burden. Beloved of Avánthe, cursed by foot traffic, plodding steadily on, transporting an empire. Complain not of the chlén to those of the High Tower, who raise them and work their hide, or to Turning Wheel, who guide the ponderous chlén carts along the Sákbe Road. And when these clans challenge each other to a race on the Sákbe Road, let the by-stander beware! It's a contest of wits, endurance and cunning. Of course, it's also strictly illegal, so keep inducements at hand and the betting under the table."

This board game is set in M. A. R. Barker's World of Tékumel. Ms. Donnelly seems to have based it loosely on her RPG scenario of the same name that appeared in Issue Seven (04/22/04) of the Book of Visitations of Glory.

37041.name: Panda Pile
37041.description: A stacking game consisting of twelve wooden pieces. Players take turns adding a piece to the growing column: slanted tubes of bamboo, leaves that stick out to the side, and one worried panda that needs to be placed safely on top of them all at the end. Although a simple stacking game intended for children, the unusual shapes allow anyone to press the limits of balance.

37043.name: Bingo Dice
37043.description:
This is a dice game in the Onsworld Jackpot Dice series (the other's being Black Jack, Crossword, Liar Poker and Lucky Fortune Dice).

Players are dealt a card which shows six 2-digit numbers. They put counters into a pot which they are vying for. The only digits which appear on the cards are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 9. On their turn, the player rolls two six-sided dice and with the two numbers rolled, forms a 2-digit number. For this purpose, the 6 can also be used as a nine. So, rolling a 1 and a 6, the player can form 16, 19, 61 or 91. All players check their card and if they have the 2-digit number, they can cover it with a counter. The player who first covers all the six numbers on his card wins the pot.

37044.name: Yonkersopoly
37044.description: Another game from the MONOPOLY family, this time featuring the streets and locations from YONKERS NY. The game was a limited edition.

37045.description: This edition of the TRIVIAL PURSUIT Year in Review Series contains questions about the highlights of the year 1993.
37045.name: Trivial Pursuit: 1993 Edition (German)

boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Gamers' Board Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
2009 JoTa Highlights of the Year Nominee
2009 Tric Trac Nominee
37046.description:
Ghost Stories is a cooperative game in which the players protect the village from incarnations of the lord of hell – Wu-Feng – and his legions of ghosts before they haunt a town and recover the ashes that will allow him to return to life. Each Player represents a Taoist monk working together with the others to fight off waves of ghosts.

The players, using teamwork, will have to exorcise the ghosts that appear during the course of the game. At the beginning of his turn, a player brings a ghost into play and places it on a free spot, and more than one can come in at the same time. The ghosts all have abilities of their own – some affecting the Taoists and their powers, some causing the active player to roll the curse die for a random effect, and others haunting the villager tiles and blocking that tile's special action. On his turn, a Taoist can move on a tile in order to exorcise adjacent ghosts or to benefit from the villager living on the tile, providing it is not haunted. Each tile of the village allows the players to benefit from a different bonus. With the cemetery, for example, Taoists can bring a dead Taoist back to life, while the herbalist allows to recover spent Tao tokens, etc. It will also be possible to get traps or move ghosts or unhaunt other village tiles.

To exorcise a ghost, the Taoist rolls three Tao dice with different colors: red, blue, green, yellow, black, and white. If the result of the roll matches the color(s) of the ghost or incarnation of Wu-Feng, the exorcism succeeds. The white result is a wild color that can be used as any color. For example, to exorcise a green ghost with 3 resistance, you need to roll three green, three white, or a combination of both. If your die rolls fall short, you can also use Tao tokens that match the color in addition to your roll. You may choose to use these after your roll. Taoists gain these tokens by using certain village tiles or by exorcising certain ghosts. One of the Taoists has a power that allows him to receive such a token once per turn.

To win, the players must defeat the incarnation of Wu-Feng, a boss who arrives at the end of the game. There are also harder difficulty levels that add more incarnations of Wu-Feng, in which to win, you must defeat all of them.

There are many more ways to lose, however. The players lose if three of the village's tiles are haunted, if the draw pile is emptied while the incarnation of Wu-Feng is still in play, or if all the priests are dead.
37046.name: Ghost Stories
boardgamepodcastepisode: 004: Live Coop & Improved Audio!
11-02-15: The SPOOKY episode! Arkham Horror on tap, Ghost Stories, Betrayal at House on the Hill and more!
AP Podcast – Episodio 9: Copycat y Last Will

HLG 6: Samen
OBG 024: International Gamers Awards

Spiele-Podcast Nr. 41: Ghost Stories von Repos

The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Antoine Bauza & Piero
Top 10 Favorite Board Games of All Time
Vox Republica 093: Ready Player Two
Vox Republica 104: You Can't Resist Us

37047.name: Word Ladder
37047.description: The game originally known as Doublet or Word-links. A player is given a start word and an end word. In order to win the game, the player must change the start word into the end word by creating a new word at each step. To do this a player must either change a letter, add a letter, remove a letter, or rearrange the letters in different order like an anagram.

37048.name: L'Entre Deux Verres
37048.description:
Step into the world of French wines: Constitute your cellar while learning interesting facts about vintages, grapes, regions etc.
Show your knowledge and collect more wine-cards than your opponents.

37049.description:
A pirate themed game for 3 to 4 players using one PiecePack (Full rules available at http://www.piecepack.org/).

Each player controls a ship full of pirates, and is allotted 2 actions a turn (to use with a list of 12 possible actions) allowing them to sail and walk around the board, trying to be the first to successfully dig up multiple pieces of treasure. To this end, they may attack the other player's pirates and even try to board opposing ships.

From the game rules introduction:
"Loose lips sink ships, and due to the loosening of several lips by a little bit of grog, several groups of pirates just realized that they've all buried their treasure near each other, in the same group of islands! Now they've all rushed out, not as much to defend their own treasure, which has no doubt been ingeniously hidden, but to unearth the booty the other groups have hidden and claim it as their own."
37049.name: Pirates of Van Zandt

37051.name: The Stock Market
37051.description:
Object of game: to be the first to accumulate $7,500 in stocks or cash of a combination of both. If played with 2-6 players, win can be raised to $10,000.

Parts:
Gameboard
Scoring Boards and Markers
Green Bull Cards
Red Bear Cards
Money of $50, $100 & $500
Dice
Stock Certificates for Colgate-Palmolive-Peet, Du Point, Otis Elevator, US Steel, Life Savers, Wrigley, Socony Vacuum, Union Carbide, Baltimore & Ohio, Union Pacific, Western Union, Phillips Petroleum, Bordens, Cudahy Packing, Illinois Central, Texas Corporation, Eastman Kodak, Bethlehem Steel, Liggett & Myers, American Can, Westinghouse, General Motors, Loose-Wiles, Northern Pacific, Radio Corp, Coca-Cola, Ny Central, Standard Oil of NJ, Atch T & Santa Fe, Detroit Edison, Packard Corp, Southern Pacific, Proctor & Gamble, Goodyear Tire & Rubber, General Electric, Pennsylvania RR, Hershey Chocolate, American Tobacco, American Tel. & Tel. Bon-Ami

37052.name: Wall Street: The Game of Speculation
37052.description:
From the instructions:

To those who enjoy a stirring game of chance, which may be controlled, to some extent, by smart judgment, this game of Wall Street will prove a fascinating diversion . . . Just as in the "Street" itself the time to buy and sell is fraught with uncertainty, so in this game it is puzzling to determine whether to take a trick with a 1-point boost to score and be "sure" -- or hold your best card for a 2- or 3-point "Win" -- perhaps to be forced, as often happens, to take a loss of 2 or 3 points because you held a "good card" too long.

Parts =

Cards in Blue, Red, Green and Violet
12 Counting Cards with "Win" or "Lose" and one "Mystery" card.
Cardboard chips in yellow, green, blue and red.

37053.name: Bulls 'N' Bears
37053.description:
Object of game - to accumulate money and stock.

Parts:
Money in $10, $50, $100, $500, $1,000, $5,000 and $10,000
Two wooden rectangle dice with Bulls and Bears on it
Stock Certificates for Autos, Bonds, Funds, Oils & Steels
"Chance" cards
Playing Cards

37054.name: The Game of Bank
37054.description:
Object of Game is to roll marbles into slots. The slots represent $1, $3, $5, $15 and $25.

Playing board is wood and highly lithographed showing a birds-eye view of a metropolitan street with cars, people, a department store, playhouse, drug store, hotel, wharf with ship and the center of it all the "Metropolitan Savings Bank".

37055.name: Wealth
37055.description:
Object of the Game: To amass the Biggest Amount of Money possible.

Parts:
Dealer card
Money = $50, $100, $500 and $1,000
Square wooden colored tokens
Share Certificates for Aircraft, Auto, Chemical, Coal, Copper, Foods, Gold, Motion Pictures, Oil, Radio, Railroad, Rubber, Shipping, Silverm Steel and Telephone & Telegraph
80 playing cards with the same above-mentioned products.

37056.name: Tenzor ar roue Korrigan
37056.description:
The king of the Goblins left. He left behind him only these words: “My friends, I need a holiday. I separated and hid my treasure in the four corners of the Large Forest. He who would find the greatest part of it will become king in my place.”

Each player directs a tribe of Goblins. During the rush towards the places where the treasures are hidden, players will have to use their Goblins, in order to find the greatest number of parts of the treasure.

When the 5 parts of the treasure are found, the player which finds the greatest number of it is declared King of the Goblins.

37057.name: Der Wald der Trolle
37057.description: The players make a tour around the village into a forest of trolls, in search for gold. Some spaces allow them to win gold rings or to take short cuts, while others force them to lose rings (unless a roll of 4), or to stop. When everyone is back home, the winner is the wealthiest player, who is not necessary the first player to have arrived.

37058.description:
Microshogi is a Shogi variant played on a 4×5 board with hybrid pieces -- non-standard pairings of standard units:

Bishop / Tokin
Gold General / Rook
Silver General / Lance
Pawn / Knight
King




A piece is promoted (flipped) whenever it captures another piece. This is mandatory even when the flip side is a weaker unit.

Also unlike 9×9 Shogi, captured pieces held in reserve can be dropped without restriction:

A piece can be dropped with either side up.
A piece can be dropped onto a rank that prohibits it from any further move.
A pawn can be dropped onto the same column as another allied pawn.
A pawn can be dropped to give immediate checkmate.




Microshogi is believed to have been designed by Shogi Grand Master Yasuharu Oyama (1923-1992).
boardgameversion: The Shogi Association George Hodges edition
37058.name: Microshogi

37059.description:
From the box:

Enter the Circus Maximus, home of Roman chariot racing. Use your influence and power to recruit experienced charioteers, to buy strong horses and chariots, and to earn the god's favor. Gain prestige and honor from your fellow citizens through victory.

From the designer's website:

GAME CONCEPT

You are a Roman Aristocrat who uses your influence and power to hire an experienced Charioteer, to acquire an excellent chariot and to buy a strong horse to compete in a chariot race. More importantly, however, you must offer sacrifices to the Gods to gain their favor as they help your team toward victory.

GAME PLAY

The game consists of a cycle of "Race Legs" wherein players play Chariot, Rider, and Horse cards in an effort to win Victory Spaces on the race track. In addition to these cards, there are also God Cards that provide special powers. Because players use up their cards ("resources") to race, in each cycle there is an opportunity to acquire more resources by making sacrifices to the gods. The more you sacrifice, the better resources you receive. However, your sacrifice power is limited, so you must be careful to use it wisely. Each cycle sets specific "Racing Conditions" that change from cycle to cycle, allowing for different strategies as the game progresses. The game contains a strong auction element, a fair amount of guesswork concerning what the other players will do, and a little bit of luck.

COMPONENTS

83 Playing Cards

1 Game Board

15 Tokens

1 Die

1 Instruction Booklet
37059.name: Charioteer

boardgameimplementation: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set
37061.description:
Star Fleet Battles Designer's Edition was the second version of the Star Fleet Battles series. An expanded & enhanced version of the original zip-lock bag version. Contains 216 full-color die cut counters representing the ships of seven fleets, freighters, outpost stations, starbases, asteroids, planets, and monsters. Also contains a large hex map, charts, and ship displays.

The Designer’s Edition followed up the successful original Star Fleet Battles Pocket Game. The original version had optional advanced rules. The Designer’s Edition divided the rules into a "Basic Game" and an "Advanced Game" and rewrote much of the optional advanced rules into the "Advanced Game" and included more ships and counters for the newly added ships. This version also included the first expansions in the Star Fleet Battles series, and it had three pocket game expansions.

There were two editions of the Designer's Edition. The second edition had a different box cover (the same cover art as Star Fleet Battles Commander's Edition Volume I) and a larger sized rulebook.

Re-implements:

Star Fleet Battles




Re-implemented by:

Star Fleet Battles Commander's Edition
Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition
37061.name: Star Fleet Battles (Designer's Edition)
boardgameexpansion: Galactic Conquest: A Star Fleet Universe Campaign Engine

37062.name: Olli Osterhase
37062.description:
Easter is approaching and Benny Bunny has his paws full. He is pleased with his job as the Easter Bunny, but he also needs a sharp mind. According to article IV of the Regulations stipulating the distribution of Easter eggs, there can never be two identical eggs is one basket. Can you help the Easter Bunny distribute the eggs properly?

The first player to get all four of their eggs into Easter baskets first wins, but placement of the eggs is not random! Using a die, plays can move the bunny, distribute an egg, or gain a carrot which has special other uses.

37063.name: Championship Sumo Wrestling
37063.description:
Championship Sumo Wrestling is a short, simple game simulating Japanese wrestling. Sumo wrestling is a sport in which the object is to either force your opponent out of a circular ring or to force him to touch the floor with any part of his body except his feet. Action is fast and furious, and typical bouts seldom last more than thirty seconds. A good way to play is for each player to generate several wrestlers and fight a series of bouts at one sitting.

Each player rolls a six-sided die for each of five characteristics- Speed, Agility, Strength, Weight, and Balance- to generate their character. When battling an opponent, certain stats are cross-referenced with any of 8 wrestling moves: Charge, Attack, Step Aside, Slap, Lever, Lift, Push, and Pull, in order to determine a result.

The game was included in issue #64 of Dragon Magazine.

37064.name: My Band
37064.description:
Battle your friends to see who can put together the most compatible band members, managers, promoters, agents and more. It's always been a dream to organize that band... so let's do it!

Use your band's influence to build your popularity or use it to effect your opponents.

Spend a night building your perfect band!

Game contents; 1 Game Board, 40 Band member cards, 40 Event cards, 20 Business cards, 4 Band Contracts, 1 Popularity Bid Card, 1 Starting player token, 16 page Rules book, 100+ influence chips and 4 game pawns.

37065.name: Associate!
37065.description:
Associate! is a racy team game suitable for parties and similar environments. It's simple to learn and great fun to play. Here's how it works:

Divide into teams and race against the clock to find the missing link between words - the more your team guesses in thirty seconds, the further round the board you go. It's a non-stop beat-the-clock battle of wits!

One member of your team reads out some of the pre-written clues, it might sound something like this: "Control", "Missile" and "Liner". Your team shouts out guesses as to what the missing word is that links those words. In this case it's "Cruise" which is linked by the phrases "cruise control", "cruise missile" and "cruise liner". You're racing against the clock to solve as many different links as you can before time runs out and your turn ends.

37066.name: Mumble Jumble
37066.description:
Everyone's looking at sheet with five anagrams from a certain category and racing to be the first to solve three of them. Here's an example of what one of the sheets included in the game:

Category: "Things you might find in a fast food restaurant"

These are the five anagrams of things within that category:

(1) A GERM BRUSH

(2) PALE PEPSI

(3) SINK PAN

(4) WARTS

(5) CHEF ‘n FERRIS

Could you be the first person to solve three of these anagrams ?

Pick up points by solving the anagrams first or simply by letting somebody else make a mistake - the winner is the person with the most points at the end of the game.

And the answers are: (1) Hamburgers (2) Apples Pies (3) Napkins (4) Straw (5) French Fries

http://www.amherstlodge.com/dirtycheats/fbg/downloads/games/...

37067.name: Bid
37067.description: Everybody plays at once. One person reads out a category name and ten items within that category (this is all provided in the file). Some of the items genuinely fall within the category whilst others don't. You have to decide how many of the correct answers you think you can correctly identify and then bid. But here's the dilemma: If you bid too high, you risk getting it wrong but if you bid too low, you might well be outbid. You've got to combine your knowledge of trivia with a little guesswork and a lot of guts to win !

37068.name: Porky Pies
37068.description:
With something like 500 questions included, Porky Pies is a game that comes with enough material to keep you going for quite some time although you only need to print off a few pages each time you play.

How the game works: You get given an old or unusual phrase (many originate from the UK in the 16th to 19th century) and have to decide which of the three explanations provided is correct. Everybody plays at once and the person who picks the most correct explanations during the course of the game is the winner.

http://www.amherstlodge.com/dirtycheats/fbg/downloads/games/...

37069.name: Dalli Dalli
37069.description: Boardgame which was published in Germany after the TV -Show Dalli Dalli by Hans Rosenthal was a tremendous success. Some special features of the show are implemented in the game (e.g Dalli Klick)

37070.name: Atmosfear: Booster Game Tape Set
37070.description:
This is an expansion VHS tape set for Atmosfear: The Harbingers game consisting of two 45 min. VHS tapes in a protective sleeve. Change the number of players by altering the number of keystones. The new tapes help increase re-playability of the game by providing fresh videos.

Expands:

Atmosfear: The Harbingers

37071.name: F' the Earth
37071.description:
Each of the players takes the role of a business friendly, let us not say corrupt, politician. Each turn represents an election cycle in which players sell out the nation's resources to moneyed interests. In the end, there must be a reckoning, and whoever sold away the last of the store will take the blame for all the selling.

http://www.fecundity.com/pmagnus/fearth.html

37072.description:
Ace Trump is a Decktet trick-taking game for 2 to 6 players. As the name suggests, playing Aces changes the trump suit.

Ransom Trump is another Decktet trick-taking game, which might be seen as a variant of Ace Trump. Trump is determined by a first round of card play before trick taking begins.
37072.name: Ace Trump

37073.name: SHRINE
37073.description: Shrine is a playing card game in which the objective is to remove all cards from the other player’s Shrine in order to win the game. During the play of the game, players may add cards to their Shrine, remove cards from the other player’s Shrine and play special cards and combos to help them win the game. Shrine uses a regular 52 card poker deck with an optional joker.

37074.name: Royal Ace-assin
37074.description:
Face cards are royal figureheads. Numbered cards are influential members of the royal court. The Aces are royal assassins. There are 3 "years" of play. At the end of the 3 years, the assassins are sent out. After all murders occur, a winner is determined. Figureheads total the political strength of their supporters. A player wins by owning the most powerful living figurehead.

http://www.pagat.com/invented/royal_ace-assin.html

37075.name: ECO-MIG
37075.description: A quiz game with the global warming and the environment as a theme, although far away from all questions are about these subjects. It is released in a small package and is suitable for travels and other locations.

37076.name: The Question Box Game
37076.description: The Frederick H. Beech company put out this game The Question Box in 1939. The game was a trivia type game where you conducted and answered what the game called a Radio Question Bee. Questions about trivia from Radio Shows of that time were featured. You drew from a large number of card questions with different degrees of difficulty and asked another game player who tried to answer the question correctly. He/she then scored points based on getting those questions correct.

37077.name: Eendenrally
37077.description: A simple game on a board (15 x 23 cm). On the board a picture for 6 pole positions. One for each player. Every player has a car (Citroen 2cv. It is placed one one of the position. Each player gets 8 cards. These cards are used to give the car a direction (left, straight on or to the right) and speed (from 1 to 5). On turn the player in front plays one card. The player behind needs to follow with his card. Each card is compared with the card of the player in front of him. If you cannot follow the direction or speed the cars change position. After playing all cards gets points according to their end position. (1 point to the first and so on) After three rounds the player with the least points wins the game.

37078.name: Zaxo
37078.description: Zaxo is a Game of tile laying to complete a line of at least 5 tiles. This is therefore just like Tantrix, but each player chooses his color secretly and can change it while playing! The layout of the tiles is different to Tantrix (only straight lines, no wiggly curves here) but there are also 4 colors (black, red, blue, green) just like Tantrix (yellow, red, blue green).

37079.name: Frontier Fort Rescue Game
37079.description: Frontier Fort Rescue Game is a simple roll and move game similar to many others of the times. There is a compass included in the game which helped determine in which direction you get to move.

37080.name: Jingle Dingle's Weather Game
37080.description: The Lowell Toy Manufacturing Corporation put out this game Jingle Dingel's Weather Game in 1953. The game is based on the weather puppet Jingle Dingel who was on American Television in the early 1950's. The game itself revolved around adding weather fronts to a map. (more info is forthcoming soon)

37081.name: 18IA: Building Iowa's Railroads
37081.description:
18IA:Building Iowa's Railroads is a single-state 18xx game set in Iowa, designed to play out in 4 hours or fewer.

Corporations:
Chicago & North Western Railway
Chicago Great Western Railway
Chicago, Milwaukee, St. Paul, and Pacific Railroad
Chicago, Rock Island, and Pacific Railroad
Chicago, Burlington, and Quincy Railroad
Fort Dodge, Des Moines and Southern Railroad

Private Companies:
Mississippi and Missouri Railroad Company
Farmers' Co-operative Contracts
Iowa State University
University of Iowa
Cedar Rapids & Missouri Railroad

37082.name: Mediums
37082.description:
Based on different esoteric skills as Tarot, Runes Astral Cards, etc.

With it you will emulate the great mediums, discovering your past, present and and future.

Learn to decipher the signs and the way of the love, the fortune and the luck.

Move around the universe represented in the board, and in a trip across the four seasons (summer, fall, winter and spring) gather the cards that guard the message for you. The cards set will be adapting the game in order to assimilate an esoteric session.

Will you be the medium? Will you be the consultant? The destiny will decide it and only at the end of the game you will discover it.

You don't need esoteric knowledges to use it.

Enter to the fantastic world of the occultism and discover your past, present and future.

Content:

- 1 board
- 4 player pieces
- 1 symbolic dice
- numeric dice
- 48 environment cards
- 48 spring cards
- 48 summer cards
- 48 fall cards
- 48 winter cards
- 1 instructions

37083.name: Poker Cinese
37083.description:
Component:
52 cards (normal deck of cards)
36 tokens divided into 4 series of colors (each set with values ranging from 0 to 4)
3 cards summary of the scores of poker American
1 block white
rules

Each player receives 9 tokens of a color and places them in front of covered if, so
randomly choose the dealer (which has the sole task of distributing the cards and not influence the course of the game), which distributes 15 cards to each player.
The game is divided into 3 rounds.
The players have split the cards received in 3 "hands" by 5 cards each, as they believe keeping in mind that the value of combinations is the normal poker. At this point the position 3 "hands" constituted, whether before, blankets and order "Pokeristicamente" decreasing (from the most powerful combination to weaker) and puts on each of 3 hands a coin covered under the bet that wants carried out.
(NB 4 players the dealer distributes 13 cards, and the third "hand", one with the lowest value, is made only by 3 cards).

When all have made bets, you start turning the first hand: the player with the highest score receives the chips on the hand, then continues in the same way for the other 2 "hands".
The chips are cashed victory points and can not be used for subsequent ballots, the game is designed so that each player must use all its chips 9 initials. At the end of the third round each player adding up the value of coins collected: who wins the highest value.

37084.name: Dumbo Card Game
37084.description: A rummy variation card game based on the 1941 Disney movie. The deck comes with 45 cards. There are 4 suits with cards numbered 1 through 11, and 1 Dumbo joker card. The game is for 2 to 4 players, but 4 players requires a second deck. First player to get to 50 points wins.

37085.name: Galactic Hero
37085.description:
“You are a brave pilot battling against enemy ships from another world. You must use your skill and cunning to survive not only the threat from enemy forces but also the evil alien race known as the Bogons.”

2 to 6 Players can play this simple, and fun, card game. Have you got what it takes to become a Galactic Hero?

The files needed to make this Print and Play Card Game can be purchased from http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=662&;pics

37086.name: Beaver
37086.description: This card game from the 1920s has a picture of a beaver named "Bonzo" on the box, but this character is not one of the animals in the game! The 52 cards of the game include 13 sets of 4. There is a 53rd card used for scoring purposes only. All of the artwork is by G E Studdy, who's most famous creation was "Bonzo."

37087.description:
Kyoto Shogi is a Shogi variant played with specialized pieces on a 5x5 board. Its most unusual feature is that every move ends by "promoting" (flipping) the piece moved.

The pieces in Kyoto Shogi are non-standard pairings of standard Shogi units:

Tokin / Lance
Silver General / Bishop
King
Gold General / Knight
Pawn / Rook




Rules for dropping are the same as in the closely related game, Microshogi.
boardgameversion: The Shogi Association George Hodges edition
37087.name: Kyoto Shogi

37088.name: Chester Gump Hops Over the Pole
37088.description: Chester Gump Hops Over the Pole is a spin and move game by Milton Bradley. The object is to get from Washington to Moscow by encountering and overcoming obstacles and detours along the way.

37089.name: Crown the Queen
37089.description:
The object of this card game is to be the first player to crown the queen. This is accomplished by laying down cards to form the queen's procession.

Each player is dealt three cards and the remainder of the pack is placed face downwards in the centre of the table. Players look at their cards and the one on the left of the dealer takes the top card from the centre pack. He then sees if he has a police-card in his hand. If so he can start the preparations for his procession immediately by laying this card on the table in front of him, face upwards. Each player makes his own procession. There are eight cards in a complete procession. If he has no police-card he passes one card, face downwards, to the next player.
If he has been able to play a police-card he takes another card from the centre pack and, if able, plays a FORCES card on to his procession and so on. When unable to add to his procession he passes any one card, face downwards, to the next player, leaving himself with three cards as at first.
Cards must be placed in a line in the following order: policeman, soldier, sailor, royal coach, page, archbishop, and queen. Each processional card placed in front of a player scores 10 points and the queen-card scores 30 points, giving a maximum of 100 points per game.

A game is completed when one player has presented the Queen for crowning or the last card of the centre pack has been taken.

There are 54 cards in the deck.

37090.name: Family Favourites
37090.description:
This 1960's card game comes with 44 cards depicting family pets. There are several different types of pets and each card has a number as well as an animal on it.

The object of the game is to be the first to get rid of your cards by playing a card with either the same animal or the same number on it as the last card played. The number of cards you start with depends on the number of players. Every turn you try to play a card. If you cannot, you must draw a card instead. Once a player goes out, a hand ends and the remaining players must add up the point values left in their hands.

After 6 rounds, the player with the lowest score is declared the winner.

37091.name: The Faraway Tree Card Game
37091.description: A card game for little children based on the Faraway Tree books by Enid Blyton. Consists of 44 cards featuring characters familiar to fans of the books. The object of the game is be the first to complete the story of The Faraway Tree by playing cards numbered 1 through 9. There are penalty cards to play against your opponents to try and slow them down.

37092.name: Farmyard Cries
37092.description:
A card game with 44 animal cards divided into 7 sets. Each set has a "Mother" card, 1 or more "young" cards, 1 or more "Where Found" cards, and 1 or more "breed" cards. The cards of each set have the same number on them. This number is the points you earn by collecting that particular set.

The object of each round is to collect 1 "Mother", 1 "young", 1 "breed", and 1 "Where Found" card from any given set. The first player to do this wins any given round and receives the points shown on that set.

The fun part for little children comes in when a player has managed to collect a "Mother", a "breed" and a "where found" card for one set. At this point that player "cries" for the young by making the sound of that animal. The idea here is that the mother of the set is calling out for her young. When this happens, any player in possession of "young" cards of that specific animal type must give them to the crying player.

The first player to 60 points wins the game.

37093.name: Cats and Dogs
37093.description:
Players move celluloid cats and dogs around the board by spinning a spinner. The first one to the finish is the winner.

Parts:
2 celluloid Cats
2 celluloid Dogs
1 spinner with a cat on it
1 game board

37094.name: The Base Ball Card Game
37094.description:
The Base Ball Card Game, designed by the Allegheny Card Company, is an unpublished prototype boxed card game. The prototype contained 112 cards featuring 104 players with an additional eight team "ball counter" cards. There is exactly one original copy of the game, discovered in the 1980s, and it has since had the cards auctioned separately by Lew Lipset in April of 2000. There seem to have been a set of rules found with the prototype, but what became of them after the components were split up is unknown.

The game was registered on April 5th, 1904. It was never published.

"In 1904, the Allegheny Card Co. produced a 112 card boxed set including 104 National League players and 8 team “ball counter” cards. This issue is believed to be the “sole” produced prototype, having never been distributed to the general public."

37095.name: Dead Heat
37095.description:
Zombie racing! Just saying it causes you to say "What the…" When some were saying "Why?" Jim Bob Joe was saying "Why not?"

Civilizations have always been judged by their sports. Since before the gladiatorial contests in ancient Rome, man has been defined by his sport of choice.

Zombie racing. What more can you say?

Dead Heat is competitive on two levels. Not only can players race the Zeds, they can bet on them too! But wait, there's more!

Marvel (laugh your butt off) as highly trained Zombies (the fresher the better) streak down the track (OK, shuffle) in their quest for the gold (dinner). But these finely tuned athletes (hungry) aren't alone. Each Zombie is assisted by a loyal trainer (baiter) who desires only to share in their triumph (make a buck) all in the name of glory (because they have no other marketable skills).
Zombie racing… the name says it all!

37096.description:
Biscuit is a Decktet game for 2 to 4 players.

Object of the game: To score points by placing cards.

Setup: Deal each player six cards. Deal one card face down in the middle of the table and another card face up crossways on top of it. The remaining cards form the draw pile.

The player to the left of the dealer takes the first turn.

On your turn, you choose one card from your hand and place extend one of the lines of cards. The card you play must match at least one suit with the card adjacent to it in line.

The first player will place a card to the left or right of the initial card. Subsequent players may place cards on the left or right side of this main line. Later in the game, there may be cross lines that allow cards to be played up or down.

If you do not have a card that can be legally played, then you must draw a card. You may play it immediately if possible. Then it is the next players' turn.

If there are no cards left in the draw pile when a player is supposed to draw, the player does not draw and play continues.
37096.name: Biscuit

37097.description:
Quincunx is a Decktet game for 2 to 4 players (with a solitaire variant).

The game is played on a five by five grid. On your turn, you add one card to the spread, score points depending on the connections between the played card and nearby cards, and possibly draw cards depending on those connections. You are penalized for any cards left in your hand at the end of the game.
37097.name: Quincunx
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #171 - If Charlemagne Was A Badger

37098.description:
Window is a Decktet solitaire game.

Object of the game: To merge all of the cards into a single pile.

Setup: Deal out nine cards face down, in a three by three grid. Deal nine more cards face down on top of those. Do it again, so that you have nine stacks of three cards each. Finally, deal one card face up onto each of the stacks.

Play: Move the cards around in certain ways to get all the cards into 2 pile to win.

Game Rules:
Window at the Decktet website
37098.name: Window

37099.description:
Bharg is a Decktet set-making game for 2 players.

Object of the game: To bind all the cards in your hand.

Setup: Each player is dealt a hand of seven cards. The dealer then deals one card face up to start a discard pile.

As the game progresses, there will be two discard piles: one for aces, the other for number cards and crowns. The discard pile for aces is called the Ace Pile.

Game play: On your turn, you may take the top card of the numbers-and-crowns discard pile or the top card of the deck. Then you discard a card.
37099.name: Bharg

37100.name: Futballkártya "2000"
37100.description: In this soccer card game the cards represent which player controls the ball and black arrows show where he can pass or shoot. The same cards also can be used for defense as red arrows show which players can tackle the ball controlling player.

37102.name: The Christian Life Game
37102.description:
"A game designed to help you master the basic principles in the Christian life."
Each player has an individual board on which their pawn moves from Salvation at game start to Future Things at game end. To advance one's pawn along this journey, players must answer Biblical questions in the categories of Prayer, Bible Study, Fellowship, Witnessing, Doctrine, and Promises.

37103.description:
Each player has 25 equilateral triangles in his color. After the first tile, players alternate playing a tile adjacent to some existing tile.

The winner is the first player to form a larger, 4-tile triangle with his color on the tips, and either color in the center.

Online Play

boardspace.net Real time, AI option
gamerz.net (play by email)
37103.name: Spangles

37104.name: Triangles
37104.description:
TRIANGLES :

Players buy 3 and 4 spaces triangles from the 36 spaces triangle of the board. In that order, they bid simultaneously and secretly for a pair of triangles on the board. When the bids are revealed, the winner of the auction marks the two acquired spaces with triangles of his colour, and gets points of reward. He then elects two new spaces on the board for sale.
Every three rounds, all players receive 100 extra points for bidding.
The Board has special areas showing the capital and scores of each player.

37105.name: Das Big Bobby Car Spiel
37105.description: Typical race game for children with very cute cars and easy rules. Contents two different boards.

37106.name: Traps & Treasures
37106.description:
Components:
-16 playing cards. Use all of the face cards and aces from a standard deck of poker cards.
-two uniquely colored pawns, one for each player.
-4x4 playing board

Win by guessing the location of your opponent’s treasure before they find yours.

Set a Trap & Hide your Treasure.
On a player’s turn they must move their pawn and they may optionally make one guess as to where their opponent’s treasure is hidden. To move a player plays one card and moves their pawn to a space in the row (or column) which is labeled with that card.

http://www.superpowernosissies.com/games/

37107.name: Pirate Treasure
37107.description:
Board has a turning disk under it to place the treasure chest in 1 of 16 holes on board, each covered with a gold coin.

Players are pirates looking to be the first to collect 25 coins. Movement is by rolling two six sided dice. Rolling doubles gives you the option to add another of your playing pieces to the board.

When you reach a hole on the board, collect the coin and check to see what's under it. The treasure chest is worth 10 coins, you can also find nothing, or be captured by another player and sent to their hideout. To be released takes one coin and a roll of doubles, or two coins without the roll.

First player with 25 coin wins.

37108.description:
Play many classics, updated for the third millennium by adding a third dimension to card games. This deck has 5 numbers, 5 colors, and 5 suits. Each card contains 1 number, 1 color, and one suit, making 125 cards, 1 for each number/color/suit combination.

This deck can play many games. (14 are currently published at with more to come when I sell 100 decks.) But all games take advantage of the fact that it's a 3 dimensional card. Play 3D versions of Crazy Eights, Memory, Spite and Malice, Speed, Poker, Rummy, Blackjack, Cassino, Euchre, Tic Tac Toe, and 2 different versions of Klondike Solitaire. Plus there's 2 games which cannot be duplicated with regular cards.

One is a 3-variable trick-taking game where you want to take certain cards but not others,Circles are worth positive points, but are the least powerful suit, and squares are negative points but the most powerful suit in terms of trick taking. But Number rank and color team declarations take precedence over suit. Can be played cooperatively, 2 on 2, or 4 for themselves. Most net positive points wins.

The other game is an elimination card game where the object is to give someone six of the same number, color, or suit to eliminate them, and to be the last one standing. Blacks, Blobs, and Question Marks always bring its owner closer to elimination. And you can play offensively on your opponents cards, or defensively to make it harder to eliminate you. A near perfect chess match with cards for 2 players, a game of negotiations if played with more.

Coming soon: 3D versions of 2 competitive solitaires, Thirty-One, Go Fish, 2 Versions of Egyptian War, another version of Spite and Malice, another version of Speed, Pope Joan, and Eleusis.
37108.name: Triple Topper

37109.name: Hex
37109.description:
Hex is an abstract strategy game for 2, 3, 4, or 6 players played on a symmetric board of 54 hexagonal spaces. Team play is possible. Each player starts with 6 plain ceramic hexagonal pieces, including 5 hexmen and 1 (taller) hexcellency which starts on his hexdom space. The winner is the player who either first moves his hexcellency to the hexdom on the opposite side of the board or whose hexcellency is the last hexcellency remaining on the board. A piece must move in a straight line not blocked by other pieces. A piece may be immobilized ("hexed") or released from a hex by certain configurations of other pieces. On a later move, a hexed piece may be removed ("captured") from the game. A player is eliminated from the game if his hexcellency is captured.

From the game box top: "the Cerulean Hexman moved swiftly into position and engaged his hexray. The Citronian was instantly hexed. Powerless and immobile, he unwillingly released the Alizarian Hexman form his certain fate. He again activated his hexray. The Citronian Hexcellence was paralyzed, ensnared hopelessly, just as victory was within his reach. His Hexdom had been conquered…"

Hex was published in 1994 as a "limited First Edition" of one thousand copies. It did not include actual hexrays.

37110.name: Whipcash
37110.description:
Don't be a victim. Protect yourself from crooked doctors, crooked lawyers and crooked insurance companies that will rip you off. Learn the dirty rotten tricks of psychological manipulation designed to get your money and can end up destroying your life.

You and your friends will have the time of your life trying to bankrupt each of the three shady pros...
then you'll have even more fun trying to bankrupt each other!

From the official website: www.whipcash.com

boardgamehonor: 2009 Charles S. Roberts Best Science-Fiction or Fantasy Board Wargame Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Gamers' Board Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
2009 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
2009 JoTa Best Artwork Nominee
2009 JoTa Best Heavy Board Game Nominee
2009 Lys Passioné Finalist
2009 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Experten Recommended
2009 Tric Trac Nominee
2010 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
37111.description:
Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game is an exciting game of mistrust, intrigue, and the struggle for survival. Based on the epic and widely-acclaimed Sci Fi Channel series, Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game puts players in the role of one of ten of their favorite characters from the show. Each playable character has their own abilities and weaknesses, and must all work together in order for humanity to have any hope of survival. However, one or more players in every game secretly side with the Cylons. Players must attempt to expose the traitor while fuel shortages, food contaminations, and political unrest threatens to tear the fleet apart.

After the Cylon attack on the Colonies, the battered remnants of the human race are on the run, constantly searching for the next signpost on the road to Earth. They face the threat of Cylon attack from without, and treachery and crisis from within. Humanity must work together if they are to have any hope of survival…but how can they, when any of them may, in fact, be a Cylon agent?

Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game is a semi-cooperative game for 3-6 players ages 10 and up that can be played in 2-3 hours. Players choose from pilots, political leaders, military leaders, or engineers to crew Galactica. They are also dealt a loyalty card at the start of the game to determine if they are a human or Cylon along with an assortment of skill cards based on their characters abilities. Players then can move and take actions either on Galactica, on Colonial 1, or in a Viper. They need to collect skill cards, fend off Cylon ships, and keep Galactica and the fleet jumping. Each turn also brings a Crisis Card, various tasks that players must overcome. Players need to play matching skill cards to fend off the problems; skill cards that don't match hinder the players success. Fate could be working against the crew, or there could be a traitorous Cylon! As players get closer and closer towards reaching their Earth, another round of loyalty cards are passed out and more Cylons may turn up. If players can keep their up their food stores, fuel levels, ship morale, and population, and they can keep Galactica in one piece long enough to make it to Earth, the Humans win the game. But if the Cylon players reveal themselves at the right moment and bring down Galactica, the Humans have lost.

Official Site, Rules & FAQ: http://www.fantasyflightgames.com/edge_minisite_sec.asp?eidm...;esem=4
Unofficial FAQ for really tricky questions: http://boardgamegeek.com/wiki/page/Battlestar_Galactica_FAQ
37111.name: Battlestar Galactica

The Long View - Battlestar Galactica
The Messy Game Room Episode 2
The Spiel #68 - That's A Wrap - 2008 Holiday Gift Guide
Thoughts on Cooperative Games
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 93!!

37112.name: Bocaro!
37112.description:
From the instructions:

"Bocaro....it's fun, fast and easy to play! Trying to get 12 strikes in a row for a perfect 300 game makes Bocaro exciting.....every time you play."

Bocaro is played and scored just like the sport of bowling.

Each player may turn over (roll) two cards in each frame, trying for a count of 10. If the first card is a strike you don't need to roll another card. If the second card is needed and gives you a combined count of more than 10, you only count 10 for a spare.

37114.name: Setting up a Wargames Campaign
37114.description:
"Almost all new wargamers start their careers by fighting a succession of single, unconnected battles;...but before very long he begins to feel that something is lacking, that these individual games...need some connecting link to make them more satisfying and to give an objective other than just trying to destroy the other fellow's army. In their words, the desire to fight campaigns rather than battles." ( From the authors introduction)

A practical book on setting up a miniatures campaign for a variety of eras stretching from ancient times to WW2, with chapters on map making & movement, contacts and battles, umpired games, supply and finance, creating worlds and characters, campaign newspapers, political skull drudgery, with full rules for the authors Hyborian Campaign set in the world of Robert E. Howards' Conan the Barbarian.

Soft cover publication. 76 pages, with one illustration and numerous tables.

37116.name: Supermind
37116.description: This is an absorbing game where players strategically place their pawns upon a circular playing board where placing holes are joined by a web of lines. Depending upon where pegs are placed, depends much on where a player already has pegs in that line of direction, because, on their subsequent turn on placing another peg in that same line will then be able to 'expel' the opponent's peg from the board! The web of lines and number of pegs in play at any one time helps confuse issues that inevitably leads to increased concentration, and the players subsequently taking the game far more seriously!

37117.name: Rouletta
37117.description: This is a game similar to Roulette, but uses more than one ball, and one of those is worth 'double' of wherever it lands. It's pure luck of course, but despite its simplicity, becomes quite addictive and is a lot of fun to play!

37118.name: Decoder
37118.description:
Decoder is so quick that you should think of it as a "warm up" game rather than a game to entertain you for a whole evening. It's simple to play, quick to explain and is a good ice breaker to get everyone into a 'gamesy' mood.

The game includes fifteen images and the idea of the game is to guess the phrase depicted by the image.

Free game here: http://www.amherstlodge.com/dirtycheats/fbg/downloads/games/...

boardgamehonor: 2009 Årets Spill Best Family Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
2009 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
2009 Vuoden Peli Family Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Vuoden Peli Family Game of the Year Winner
2010 Boardgames Australia Awards Best International Game Nominee
37120.description:
In Pack & Stack the players try to fill their trucks as perfectly as possible.

Players start each round with a random selection of different-sized goods, determine by the roll of several dice. Then each player takes one or two trucks from the supply face-down (numbers depend on the number of players) The trucks are revealed simultaneously and each player tries to make a quick assessment to get the truck that is most useful for his or her supply of goods. Players stack the goods in the space of their selected truck defined by the boundaries on the truck-bed and the height restriction noted on the truck. Players get negative scores if the truck they picked was too large (a lot of unused space at 1 point per unused space) or too small (a lot of goods don't fit at 2 points per space of goods that would not fit). The player who gets the lowest negative score in a round gains 10 points. Players "pay" points for their negative values, and rounds continue until at least one player no longer has any points; the player with the most points wins.
boardgameversion: Dutch promotional game for Van Uden
37120.name: Pack & Stack
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ55: ¡De mudanzas! (2008) Bernd Eisenstein
OBG 37: More than the Rules
Pack & Stack
PGGK 037: Pack & Stack

37122.name: Try it Again
37122.description: Played by two and up to six people, each using a numbered disc to be found in the upper left hand corner. Any player can start this game. Each advances his disc the number of squares indicated on the spinner. Should the disc be advanced to a square with a double number (red and black), he/she is forced to move to the square indicated by the red number. If the disc falls into a square marked TRY IT AGAIN, player is allowed another spin. The player who is the first to reach the red square marked 92 or 93 is the winner.

37123.name: Wratismania
37123.description: Wratismania is an educational boardgame made by Polish artist. His purpose was to teach people about Wrocław -- a Polish city, the capital of Lower Silesia. Players are moving on the map using three methods of communication: by bus, by taxi and on foot. By visiting various places they collect cards with brief description of place. The player who will get the most cards, wins.

37124.name: Quiz 2000
37124.description:
Trivia game made by MB.
Similar to Trivial Pursuit (same questions categories), if a roll and move game on a solar system. You might to collect all the planets (like Mercury, Venus,...) and arrive to the end of the table.

Components:

252 Question Cards (quiz 2000 cards,general question)
200 Question Cards (planets cards)
6 Player piece
36 Planets Rings
1 Rule Book

37125.name: La Riga
37125.description:
From instructions:

"The Magnetic Game of Toggle Pins"

A game of skill and action wherein the player tries to pull his own color Toggle Pins into his "fenced-in" area by skillful manipulation of a magnet.

The bottom portion of the box is used as the playing platform and is first assembled into a raised platform by attaching 4 plastic legs. Each player sits at one side of the platform next to his or her "GOAL". Each player selects 20 Toggle Pins of the same color has their "GOAL" and places them in the center of the board. Each player then takes a magnet.

Magnets are rubbed under the playing surface to break up the pile of pins and guide them into their home goal. Each time a player draws a wrong colored pin into their own Goal, they must pick up that pin and one of their own and return both to the center enclosure.

37126.name: Festival Climbers
37126.description:
It is the season of celebration and it all starts when the young men of the village compete to ring the bell for
the honor of their families and to signal the start the festival. This ancient competition requires strength,
stamina and teamwork. Players will take the roll of a team of climbers that must race to the top of the
temple to start the celebration; they are bound by strict rules and are rewarded for how high on the temple
they are able to climb.

Free Game from Here: http://www.pyromythgames.com/free_games.html

37127.name: Uno: 30 Year Anniversary Edition
37127.description: The same basic Uno game, but it adds in an Anniversary Card that allows a player to give all their cards except one to another player.

37128.name: Points Total
37128.description:
A very simple game from PyroMyth Games. 1 page of rules, 1 page with the board and tiles on it. Each player receives 4 tiles. These tiles have arrows pointing different directions and a point value. After a player places a tile they score their points for that play. Points are totaled by adding the value of the tile plus the value of the board position or tile if it has been played on that every arrow on their tile points to.

Full Game: http://www.pyromythgames.com/offerings/freegames/freegames.h...

37129.name: OP∙Position
37129.description:
The goal is to capture 4 Checkers of one color or 6 checkers total. Each player takes a turn moving one of the checkers on the outside ring of the board, and then moving the die which is in the center of the board.

Full Game: http://www.pyromythgames.com/offerings/freegames/opposition/...

37130.name: Neptune Ruler of the Sea
37130.description: Neptune uses 1-2 decks of regular playing cards. You also need a trident (search for a 3-tined fork) and the crown included. The Starting player plays some cards from his hand which must be all the same kind, but any number of them. The other players then in turn lay down cards which try to beat his. The winner takes all the cards. The Crown and the Trident are gained in special ways and have special powers for use during the game.

37131.name: Indivisible
37131.description:
