Ships for all major combatants of this era have been included in one of the Fleet Registries.

The Fleet Registries contains all the data required to play this game. Players should use this information when ever possible. However, many ships during the course of their life would under go changes. The Fleet Registries contains data on only one point of time for each class. Players should allow other versions of the ships provided they can be documented.

Contains:
Rules
WWI Fleet Registry
WWII Fleet Registry

37357.description:
Content : 40 white and yellow pawns, a board with two parts : a fixed glass where pawns are set, and downside an octagonal board showing ten curves (each joining 4 dots) that you can turn by an angle of 45°.

Players at their turn put a pawn above the glass and turn the octagonal board by 45°. First player to set four of his pawns upon the same curve wins.
37357.name: Zodiac

37358.description:
Newest game from the pair that made 1960: The Making of the President. The goal here is to be the founding father with the most renown at the end of the game, which consists of the making of the US constitution.

Each round, an article of the constitution is put up for consideration, which is either a Federalist, Anti-Federalist, Big State, or Small State issue. Players have a hand of three delegate cards that represent their respective states and also have a special ability. Players may use these cards' special abilities, use the cards to vote for or against the issue under consideration, or to try and claim tokens in each of the four types of issues. When a round ends, the issue either passes, or is flipped to its opposite side (Federalist/Anti or Big/Small).

Players score points for having voted with the majority, and also for having tokens matching the issue types that are voted into the constitution.
37358.name: Founding Fathers
boardgamepodcastepisode: D6G Ep 65: Extra Life, Myriad Games Interview, Founding Fathers Detailed Review
Episode 004
ET43: Volvemos, artistas invitados los Padres Fundadores y los Robber Barons
I've Been Diced! episode 40: Jason Matthews
NvP 7x01 - Founding Fathers with Christian Leonhard and Jason Matthews
OBG 98: First Impressions
RJ51: Jocs de taula i política amb Jason Matthews
RJ52: S'albira DAU 2015, Game Studies a la URV i un Victus all nite long!
Session Impressions: Founding Fathers
The Spiel #121 - A More Perfect Union

37359.name: The Blue and the Grey:  Grand Tactical Rules for the American Civil War
37359.description:
As the game title would indicate, these are miniatures rules for fighting large scale American Civil War battles. One infantry stand is made up of four figures and each figure is 100 men. The basic element is a brigade, which is typically four-five stands. The ground scale is 100 yards for 15mm or smaller; for 25-30 mm figures, all distances should be doubled. The time scale is 1 turn = 20 minutes, which is fairly short for a grand tactical set of rules.

Game turn sequence is as follows:

1. Activation (each division or cavalry brigade rolls a die to determine if they can move effectively that turn)
2. First Move Determination
3. Combat Phase One (first mover moves and fires)
4. Morale Phase One (first mover)
5. Combat Phase One (2nd mover moves and fires)
6. Morale Phase Two (2nd mover)
7. March Phase (both sides make march moves)
8. Rally Phase (routing/retreating units may attempt rallies)

The game includes orders of battles (but not maps or scenario rules) for: First Bull Run, Shiloh, Gettysburg, and Chickamauga.

37360.name: Robbies Tafel Avontuur
37360.description: This is an educational game designed to help children learn their multiplication tables. The board has a number of spaces in a single path. Players roll the die and must undertake any tasks in the space they land on. These may be running from nasty hounds, or drawing a card and answering the math question. First player to the end wins.

37361.description:
(ADG’s Description:)

Commandoes in Flames adds a number of units and rules that can be used with Factories in Flames or with any game of A World in Flames.
Flak units, Road and Rail line construction, Coastal Fortifications, and of course the special forces themselves are all included.


A World in Flames Expansion.

Commandoes in Flames is part of the 2008 WiF Annual that also includes:
• 200 full-colour counter countersheet
• Factories in Flames
• Commandoes in Flames
• 3d10 in Flames kit
• 1 full colour WiF Combat chart
37361.name: Commandoes in Flames

37362.description:
A game of strategical placement as players have a deck of 36 robots with six cards each of values 0 to 5, and they want to maximize the value of their rows or columns of robots on a 5x5 grid.

The value of a row is the sum of the robots in it, except that a pair of identical robots in a row is worth ten times the face value of a single robot (two 3s gives you 30 points, but of course two 0s is still worthless); place three robots of the same type in a row, however, and they're worth 100 points no matter which type they are. The goal isn't to max out your score, but rather to beat your opponent as whoever has the lowest-valued row or column at game's end loses. Since 11 of the cards don't come into play, you have to play the odds on which robots will shuffle your way.

A reworking of Dragon Master. Main differences: in Dragon Master you had only 5 cards in hand; you had only 30 cards so just 5 were out of the game and instead of the ten times/100 points score rows were simply evaluated based on the number of similar cards in them. Robot Master also provides rules for 1 and 4 players.

Online Play


Jijbent.nl (turn-based, Dutch)
YourTurnMyTurn.com (English - turn based)
Mindgames.com (solitaire version)
37362.name: Robot Master
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 80 - Eurogames for the iPhone and iPad

37363.name: Take five
37363.description:
Contents: a 6×6 board, 4 series of squared pawns numbered from 1 to 9, 9 tokens for counting games, 4 chess pieces: white bishop, black bishop, black knight and black rook.

The pawns are shuffled face down and set upon the board. Then each player moves a pair of chess pieces upon the pawns and chooses one of the following option : look secretly the numbers hidden by both pawns, or look at only a single value, and capture the other pawn. The highest score wins the game

37364.name: Tanks Alot
37364.description:
Tactical combat simplified for miniature battles.

Tanks Alot is a very brief rules set the contains guidelines for creating tank units and then battling it out.

37365.description: Pterraductyl, #2 in the Duck Trilogy, adds "tactical airborne combat" to the world of Polywumpus. In this installment giant mutant ducks have taken to the sky. Modern technology is of no use, so adventurous pilots have taken to the air in antiques to defend mankind.
37365.name: Pterraductyl

37366.name: Frenzied Finance
37366.description:
Object of game is to accumulate the greatest amount of cash and stock value. Game time is predetermined by the players either a set time or when the bank is unable to make a purchase of stock offered it. Game may be played by 4 to 10 players. One player becomes the Banker and issues money and buys and sells stock for the bank. Another player becomes the Caller who spins the price wheel, marks the stocks up or down, keeps a record of the stock prices on the price sheet, and calls the stocks.

Game parts:
One Price Board with Quick Reference Table for Computing Transactions of Over 100 shares
9 "+" up markers
1 "c" corner markers
Game Money in the amount of $2 million
1500 shares of stock in 14 companies represented
50 Price Sheets

Stock Certificates are: Oils, Cons.; Lumber Co.; Coppers, Cons.; Drugs, Inc.; Airways, Inc.; Telephone Co.; Railroad, Cons.;Steel, Cons.; Insurance Co.; Foods, Inc.; Motors, Cons.; Pictures, Inc.; Utilities, Inc.; and Equipments, Inc.

37367.name: The Liners
37367.description: Starting with a 737 players attempt to build a profitable airline in a variable economic situation. A short one page economic game for 1-2 players.

37369.name: Indiana Jones Card Game 2nd Edition
37369.description:
The man with the Hat is back, in the Indiana Jones Card Game 2nd Edition. This FREE Print and Play card game features new artwork, some different cards, and images from all 4 movies.

In the game deck there are several artifact cards; the player with the highest value of artifacts when the last card is drawn, wins the game. Use your Action Points to defeat villains and to complete your adventures, as you try to collect the most artifacts, but watch out other players may try to steal from you.

Indiana Jones is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making. This game is completely FREE for you to download, print and play.

37370.name: Seii Taishogun
37370.description:
The Shogunate hold is weakening. Across the islands, castles are conquered and temples are razed as regional warlords wage war to expand their influence and power. A shift in power is inevitable, and this conflict will know no end until all of Japan has been bled over.

In Seii Taishogun, players are Daimyo during Japan’s Sengoku period. In attempts to increase their power and broaden their influence, players will struggle for control of important locations on each of Japan’s four islands, and there are several methods to do so. Conquering revolves around the use of Samurai tokens, whether it be taking a poorly guarded pagoda or persuading the residents of a castle that siding with you would be in their best interest. When the game ends, players are awarded points for the locations they control, the player with the most points is named Seii Taishogun.

Seii Taishogun (2nd Edition) Contents:

40 Samurai Cards
40 Wooden Area Markers
4 Island Cards
12 Sengoku Location Cards
1 Wooden Supremacy Marker
4 Army Hierarchy Cards
Rules




Seii Taishogun (1st Edition) Contents:

40 Wooden Samurai Tokens
40 Wooden Area Markers
4 Wooden Island Tiles
12 Sengoku Location Cards
1 Wooden Supremacy Marker
4 Army Hierarchy Cards
Rules

boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
2009 Japan Boardgame Prize Voters' Selection Nominee
37371.description:
Everyone knows the cake rules: one person cuts,the other chooses. In this way, one makes the slices as equal as possible so that one does not end up with the short end. But this rule does not apply to "...aber bitte mit Sahne (...but please, with whipped cream)." Here a person can cleverly offer larger pieces to the others and still get the most in the end.

5 cakes with 11 slices of different varieties are divided. Each variety awards a different amount of points. One can immediately eat slices to guarantee a number of points, or collect them in the hope of scoring bonus points for having the most of that variety at the end of the game. Only skilled dividers with an eye on their opponents’ pieces can score the most points and win the game.
37371.name: Piece o' Cake
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 23 - MeepleCon 2017 Recap
Piece o' cake

37372.name: The Game of '49
37372.description:
Game board has 49 rectangular card size spaces. Each space has a theme, i.e. "The pathfinder", "prairie beef" and "Read em and weep."

Game has 49 cards that match each space on the board. Also has "claim jumper" cards. Lots of paper money which is called "Nuggets"

37373.name: Trirremes
37373.description:
Game included with Alea Magazine nº8.
Naval tactical game system of the antiquity. It includes three scenarios: Alalia, Artemison and Piratas.

37374.description:
Game included with Alea Magazine nº6.

Battle of the Franco-Prussian war.
37374.name: Loigny

37375.name: Hoplita
37375.description:
Game included with Alea Magazine nº4.

System of game of the antiquity, includes scenerio battle Cannas.

37376.description:
From the Publisher:

What do the best gem dealers in the world do when their discriminating clients demand the finest of gems for their prized collections? Everything they can - and anything they have to.

Gem Dealer is a game of strategy in which players collect priceless gems through a bidding process that involves cunning, calculation and a bit of bluffing. But bidders beware! The risks you take might pay off, or they could cost you a fortune.

Gem Dealer combines fun and suspense and daring and luck. But only the shrewdest Gem Dealer of them all will walk away in the end with the winning collection.

Re-implements:

Attacke
37376.name: Gem Dealer
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 64 - Session Reviews: Ghost Stories, Wasabi, and Gem Dealer

37377.name: Schnitzeljagd
37377.description:
Through field and forest is the Schnitzel Hunt. Up to 10 hunters pursue the goal. This isn't so simple as there are many false trails, detours, and adventures cause many delays. The game takes luck and skill to win.

---

Kreuz und quer durch Feld und Wald führt eine Schnizeljagd. Bis zur 10 jäger versuchen, rasch zum Ziel zu kommen. Dies ist gar nicht so einfach, den viele Fehlspuren, Umwegen, und allerei Abenteuer verursachen immer wieder Auftenhalte. Es gehört neben dem notwendigen Glück auch eine Geschichtlichskeit dazu, als Sieger ans Ziel zu kommen.

37378.name: Marienkäfer Puck
37378.description:
A ladybug flies through the flowering seasons, from winter flurries to the end of Fall. Through his travels he (and all of the players) learn about many flowers and about how a wonderfully pretty a planned garden can be.

---

Ein Marienkäfer fliegt durch das Blumenjahr, vom Schneeglöckchen bis zur Herbstzeitlosen. Dabei lernt er (und alle Mitspieler) viele Blumen und auch mancherlei Getier auf einem wunderschönen bunten Plan kennen.

37379.description:
Netzwerk is a re-issue of Morisi. The object of the game is for the players to connect city areas (black) via trade routes. These trade routes will pass through the various areas: farmland (yellow), hills (orange), mountains (red), timberland (green) and water (blue). Before trade routes can be built, the players must gain knowledge about these various region types by traveling through them with their pawn. As cities are connected by trade, the players’ success is represented by the size and number of their trading houses in the connected cities.

The games of Netzwerk and Morisi have many similarities, but each uses different tile components, have different scoring mechanisms, and Netzwerk introduces 2 elements NOT in Morisi (wasteland + city values), and to win you'll need to play both games very differently.

Re-implements:

Morisi
37379.name: Netzwerk

boardgameimplementation: Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age
Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age with Mediterranean Expansion
boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2009 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
2009 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
2010 Boardgames Australia Awards Best International Game Nominee
2010 Games Magazine Best New Family Game Winner
2010 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2010 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
2010 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Nominee
2010 Spiel Des Jahres Nominee
37380.description:
In Roll Through the Ages, players roll dice to obtain commodities and workers to build up their civilizations. Dice can be rerolled twice unless they come up as a hazard. Players use their workers to build infrastructure to support additional works or to build monuments that are worth points. At the same time, commodities are gathered that allow your civilization to develop. Once all monuments or five developments are achieved by a player, the game ends at the end of the round, points are counted, and a victor is declared.

The game takes its name from Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization, although the two games have different styles and designers.
boardgameversion: Gryphon Games bookshelf edition first printing
White Goblin Games Dutch/French Third Edition
37380.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
boardgameexpansion: Roll Through the Ages: The Late Bronze Age
boardgamepodcastepisode: #25: Scythe review & on tap; Brian Suhre interview (Coldwater Crown preview); Mergers & Buyouts, part 3
BGB Volume 66 - Session Reviews: Giants, Playing Gods, and Roll Through The Ages
BGB Volume 77 - Q&A with Matt Leacock at Orccon 2010
BGWS 056 – Roll Through the Ages
Episode 28: Istanbul and Tier Two Games
Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1
Low Player Count - Ep. 15 - The Filler Episode
OBG 88: The Rules of Rules
Session Impressions: Roll Through the Ages
Spiele-Podcast Nr. 81: Im Wandel der Zeiten - Das Würfelspiel - Bronzezeit (Pegasus)
The Dice Section 1: Roll Through the Ages
The Spiel #104 - Spiel des Schpiel 2010

37381.name: Monopolo Esperantujo
37381.description: A print-and-play translation of Monopoly into Esperanto. Adds four new cards to each of Chance and Community Chest. The money has different sizes for different denominations and is denominated in 'steloj,' or stars. The property names are changed as well; for example, Pennsylvania Avenue becomes 'Ŝoseo de Zamenhof.'

37382.name: Monopoly: Wonder of The World
37382.description:
The classic real estate game. Buy properties, build houses and hotels, collect rent from fellow players. Repeat as necessary until everyone else is bankrupt.
Build your real estate in wonders of the world.

37383.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

In the spring of 1940, the French Army appeared invincible. They awaited the expected German offensive with great confidence, ready to repel their ancient foes and overwhelm them in 1941 with a massive wave of new armored divisions. Instead it was the German panzers that did the overwhelming. Despite heroic efforts in which over 90,000 French soldiers lost their lives, within six weeks France had fallen.

1940 - The Fall of France is a stand-alone game in the Panzer Grenadier series. You do not need any other game in the series to play any of the 50 scenarios. Design is by wargame veteran Philippe Leonard of Belgium, who has crafted scenarios involving the French Army on the attack and on the defense, with units ranging from the elite Foreign Legion and Coloniale to the pitiful second-line reserves.

Pieces include the huge array of French armor: S35 cavalry tanks, B1-bis heavy tanks, FT17, R35, R40, H39. H35 and FCM 36 light tanks. Panhard, AMR33, P16 and AMR35 armored cars and reconnaissance tanks. Plus the bizarre C2 multi-turreted heavy tank. Plus many types of troops and support weapons, from motorcycle troops and horsed cavalry through the awesome 155mm GPF rifle.

The Germans receive their full set of panzers, from the puny PzKw I through the PzKw IIIE and 38t. There are vehicles not seen before in the Panzer Grenadier series like the SiG33 assault gun, and a set of pieces for Infantry Regiment Grossdeutschland in their own colors.

There are eight semi-rigid mapboards, the same type as those found in Eastern Front, created by Guy Riessen, who crafted the widely-praised maps for Elsenborn Ridge.
37383.name: Panzer Grenadier: 1940 – The Fall of France
boardgameexpansion: Panzer Grenadier: 1942 – The Defense of France

37385.name: Fingerball
37385.description: A game of fast-action finger flickin' fun! The game materials include a wooden playing field with a goal in each corner, 2 steel marble pucks and 8 rubber "shoes". Each player or team takes 4 matching color "shoes" and places them on the middle and index finger of each hand. The puck is then "kicked" with the finger shoes. Players defend their goals by staying outside of their goal lines. Fouls can be committed and free shots are awarded. The winner is the first player or team to score 5 goals.

37386.name: Port Singapore
37386.description:
In Port Singapore you are paid by the load. So your team of grunts better work hard for you. But making money should not be too hard, this is the busiest port in the world.

The Port Singapore board is divided into bays. Next to the board lie the ships that need to be loaded. Each ship has a hold that needs to line up with one of your bays before you can get your grunts to load the goods (barrels). Along the back of the board is a track on which 4 action cubes sit. On your turn you pick up one of the cubes, do the action, then slide all the cubes forward putting your cube at the end. Cubes usually have a cost involved in choosing them, but they get cheaper the farther they move down from the top of the track. The actions on the faces vary from cube to cube, you may only take the action shown on the top face of the cube when you choose it.

The cubes contain actions like:

Heave ho. Pull a ship along the wharf or send full ships off and get new ships to load. Good for annoying players who may be about to load or bringing a ship to your warehouse bay.
Union meeting. Shuffle you grunts around the wharf and roll one of the action cubes for a random result.
Do business. This gets goods in your ware house to load or lets you hire grunts to do your loading.
Load a ship. Move one load per grunt into a ship's hold opposite to your warehouses.
Take a bribe. Helps you get things done.
The Payoff. Pay one of your opponent's grunts to simply go home for the day.
Brawl. Cause a ruckus in the bay next to one of your bays, good for disrupting opponents.




The game ends when the barrels in the supply run low (depending on the number of players). The player who has made the most money wins.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Gamers' Board Game Nominee
37387.description:
An extra Treefrog game for Essen 2008.

A relatively simple train game set in North America and involving shares and building railway lines with a few twists thrown in.

Each player uses their investment cubes to bid for control of companies, (six in all). When you take control of a company you receive one share, which means that only one share per turn can be purchased. The cubes you bid with go into the company and allow it to build track. Each location has a value which determines how much profit you receive for connecting it. After companies have built as much track as they can players are paid the profit that each company they control has made this turn. Profit levels are reset for the following turn. Players get another set of cubes to bid with and then bid again for control of companies.

Cash earned from shares is really victory points, it cannot be used to bid on future shares. As each player receives the same number of investment cubes each turn there is no positive feedback for owning the best shares.

The game lasts five turns. At the end of the game each company will pay out an additional amount of profit to each share held. This level is determined by how many different regions a company is connected to, (it's a little more involved than that, and coloured cubes are moved around!).

More information can be found on the official website.

About Steel Driver, Martin Wallace states in the rulebook: "I’ve had it in mind to develop and update the system used in Prairie Railroads to fix some of the rougher elements."
37387.name: Steel Driver
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 026 – Random Top 10 Games

37388.description:
A trio of expansions that were released by Alban Viard at Essen 2008. The print run was 120.

Chile is a long, narrow map approximately twice the size of a normal expansion and features extremely valuable gold cubes.

Egypt is notable for its flood and pyramid mechanics, both of which alter the gameplay in substantial ways.

CCCP is a unique new map with altered victory conditions.
37388.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Chile, Egypt and CCCP

37389.name: USA & Canada Pegboard Football
37389.description:
Pegboard Football is based upon a wooden rectangular board with peg-holes indicating 5-yard increments that are off-set alternating every 5-Yards from one side of the field to the other, representing an entire American Football field, or the Canadian version for one when modified for that, stretching from Goal Line to Goal Line.

Components:

Board with peg-holes depicting 5-Yard increments and the GOAL lines at each end of the FIELD.
2-Pegs of different colours are utilized, to denote the current Player having possession during PLAY.
2 d6 required as a minimum, although a 3rd d6 can be used to track DOWNS.




Alternative methods for creating this:
1) Magnetized Version: With the appropriate materials at your disposal, then you can affix some reasonable DISPLAY of the Playing Field upon a metallic surface conducive to adhering the necessary components for this. That is in place of constructing it out of anything in which peg-holes were to then be used, for where this is so desired.

2) Paper/Cardstock Materials: From whatever types of this for which you have on hand, and that you can provide the required components needed in order to PLAY, then by all means use such to implement everything and ENJOY!

37390.name: Rug Amuck
37390.description:
RUG AMUCK
Ahtnam's Flying Carpet Marketplace has experienced an unexpected magical surge, which has caused the neatly piled flying carpets to run amuck.

The players, representing apprentice carpet riders, attempt to impress Ahtnam by organizing the showroom before doors open for business.

RUG AMUCK is a matching game where players are attempting to match pairs of flying carpets. The player who matches the most pairs will impress Ahtnam and be named the Master Carpet Rider. Just pay close attention to the carpets that all look somewhat alike, and don't forget to watch your back.

Rug Amuck includes:
48 flying carpet tiles (24 pairs)
5 apprentice pawns
1 die
5 player summary cards
1 rules sheet

Rules sheet includes 3 methods of play ranging from friendly to cut throat.

37391.name: Scotland Yard
37391.description:
The criminal is in the city of London. The players are detectives from Scotland Yard who have the mission to discover his hiding place, identify him and capture him.

The game board represents the centre of London and is divided into 10 sectors. The detectives must enter in each sector in order to find clues and information. A compartment called "secret report" contains the solution to the riddle. On both sides of the plane are the faces of the suspects. Through an identikit process developed during the game, the detectives will form the face of the real culprit.

Content:
1 board game that includes the compartment "secret report"
6 pawns (detectives)
22 cards with the 10 sectors of the plane and the identikit of suspects
3 chips for the identikit
Book annotations
1 die

37392.description:
Publisher blurb: 'With the sailing of FLEETS 2025: East China Sea, Victory Point Games launches you on a Chris Taylor designed blue water adventure of high-stakes ‘political poker’ centered on daring air and naval engagements between the modern fleets of the United States and China as the Taiwanese flash point of the East China Sea ignites into a crisis on the brink of spinning out of control. Here, player nerve and skill are required to hunt the opposing forces and inflict sufficient military damage to break their political will and get them to “blink first” and back down!

In this low-to-moderate complexity wargame, the great concerns of modern naval warfare are handled with fine design elegance to highlight the asymmetrical forces, systems and tactics used by both sides through the lethality of modern weaponry. With deep strategic puzzles and wild military and political action simulated by the simple use of fast-action card play and lots of dice, FLEETS 2025: East China Sea is a nautical thrill-ride through tomorrow’s headlines for budding Admirals.

Ages: Ages 12 and up
Complexity: 4 out of 9
Solitaire Suitability: 1.5 out of 9
Scale: Each unit is 1-2 major ships & escorts or 1-3 squadrons of planes; each turn half a day.

Game Components:
• 5 pages of color Rules: Basic and Admiral Level; 2 pages color Example of Play; 1 page of Notes
• 1 page of Scenarios
• 80 color, die-cut 5/8” two-sided game pieces
• 60 ‘Activity’ cards
• One 11” x 17” color game map
• 2 Player Aid Sheets'

Buy Microbadge
37392.name: Fleets 2025: East China Sea

37393.name: Pokémon Munchin' Munchlax
37393.description: Similar to Mr. Mouth, the Munchlax head rotates in the middle, with the mouth opening and closing as players attempt to launch small plastic pieces of food into it within the allotted time. Players are then scored based on how much food they managed to get into Munchlax's mouth (20 points for a triangle "cheese" piece, 10 for a round "apple" piece, and 5 for a "donut").

37394.name: Kayak Chaos
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #79 - You Know, For Kids!
37394.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Be the first to maneuver your kayak up, down, and across a river that you build as you go! But be careful - rocks and competing kayakers are bound to stir up some chaos!"

Each player may play up to three cards from their hand on their turn. The cards allow basic actions (paddling down the river, paddling across the river to avoid rocks, or shifting a section of the river to clear your path) as well as powerful actions (a kayak flip turns an entire tile 180 degrees, a whirlpool exchanges two adjacent tiles, and a life ring that can "counter" an opponent's play)

37395.name: Penguin Rescue
37395.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Get ready to travel across Antarctica with Riley and his family as you race to rescue five penguins in danger and return them home safely! Packed with informative facts, twists and turns, Penguin Rescue is based on the award-winning book Adventures of Riley: South Pole Penguins."

On a player's turn, two dice with colored faces are thrown. The player may elect to resolve the dice in either order, which offers one of the minor strategy points in the game. One side of the die says WILD which allows a card to be drawn which immediately has an effect on the player (move back, move ahead etc).

Be the first to collect a full set of the five colored penguins and return to home to win.

37396.name: Turtlemania
37396.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Based on an ancient Chinese Mahjong game, race to dismantle 136 colorful and uniquely designed tiles by matching identical pairs as fast as you can. The more quickly you make matches, the more points you earn!"

The action is simultaneous and frantic. Players quickly pull matching tile pairs from among the free outside edge. (Some tiles are deceptively similar without actually matching!) The player or team with the most pairs wins.

boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
37397.description:
The 4th expansion for Power Grid, with boards for Korea and China.

The Korean board comes with two separate resource markets (North/South).

The Chinese board has rules for the planned economy in China - power plants come out in ascending order during step 1 and step 2.

Expands:

Power Grid
37397.name: Power Grid: China/Korea

37398.name: fun-et-iks
37398.description:
"The play on words game"

From the instructions:
Solve the who, what or where questions and race to the center square. At the center square, solve a scrambled question to win the game.

37399.name: Oil Tycoon
37399.description:
From the back of the box:

During the years since Col. E. A. Drake brought in his first oil well in 1859, the Discovery of Oil has made more men wealthy than any other single endeavor. Oil, now as then, is just waiting to be discovered. Yet, only a few men - a special breed of men - seem to solve its Mystery and find it. What do these men possess that sets them apart from the average person?

They are almost always bold and intelligent... they know Land Values and how to collect and analyze clues. Their Business Prowess enables them to expand their oil fortune by Investing in other enterprises. They not only own vast empires, but control them with their own decisions. Indeed! Few people qualify for the extraordinary title of "Oil Tycoon"

CHALLENGE
This game offers you an opportunity to see if you have what it takes to join those elite ranks! You will receive an inheritance to start your own empire. The oil is out there somewhere just waiting. The rest is up to you. With skill and a little luck, you might become the next "Oil Tycoon."

boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
37400.description:
This is another game in Zoch's "small square box" line and seems to be a follow-up to Reiner Knizia's Pickomino.

There are five dice. Each dice has:

2 x Sushi (blue)
2 x Fishbone (red)
1 x Chopsticks (blue)
1 x Chopsticks (red)

There are 24 tiles:

12 x Sushi (blue) ... Worth +1 to +6 points
12 x Fishbone (red) ... Worth -1 to -4 points

Players roll dice to try and collect "Sushi" and "Fish Bone" tiles from the centre of the board (the tile they get depends how many they rolled).

Players can also steal tiles from other players by rolling 3 or more appropriately coloured "Chopsticks" on their dice. 3 Chopsticks allows you to take the top tile from an appropriate pile from another player, 4 or 5 chopsticks allows you to nominate which tile from the pile you want, but you are not allowed to look first.

At the end of the game (when the tiles are all gone), players score points based on the tiles they have collected, however if you have more blue tiles than red tiles, you lose the excess blue tiles first!

This game is part of The Chicken Family of Zoch.
37400.name: Sushizock im Gockelwok
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ7: Sushi Bar (2008) Reiner Knizia
Spiele-Podcast Nr. 36: Sushizock im Gockelwok von Zoch
The Messy Game Room Episode 9

37401.name: Scrabble: Chocolate Edition
37401.description:
"A tasty game for family and friends'

In a variation on the classic game of scrabble, players choose 5 tiles (instead of 7), each of which is double sided. All other rules are the same such as scoring (e.g. double letter, triple word etc). The board however is slightly smaller (9x9 instead of 15x15) and the game is a lot quicker.

The two major differences with this edition:
1) It comes with an edible gold medallion for the winner and
2) all the tiles are edible!

37402.name: Biz-bluff
37402.description:
Contents: a board representing a town, 4 coloured pawns, 4 credentials cards, 12 business folders, 20 “biz-bluff” cards, a dice.
Players sell and buy stocks, trying to earn as much as possible from opponents, and of course, to be the wealthier at the end of the game. Pawns movements are decided by the dice, and so are the cards to be drawn, but it is mainly a game of bluff and memory.

37403.name: Jeux de mots
37403.description:
Contents: a 8×12 board, 2 holders, 280 letter squares, 20 blank squares, 20 symbol squares, a roulette.

There is no less that seven different games submitted there.
“Three letters and more” is an adaptation of a TV game: three letters are set on the board, then each player tries to add a new letter to build a longer word.
“Crossworlds” looks like scrabble, but unused letters are kept in holders and the person who stocks 16 letters or more there loses the game.
In “Scrambled Words” each player tries to guess the secret word of his opponent. Anagrams increase scores.

37404.description:
Vaipa Express' Up Front expansion depicting the Waffen SS. This expansion contains a set of Personality Cards for the Waffen SS and rules for their use.

Expands:

Up Front




Expanded by:

The Polish Never Quit!
37404.name: Waffen SS/The Fanatics

37405.name: Leap Frog Dominoes
37405.description: This is an educational variation on dominoes. Each domino has two three-letter words, with a corresponding picture, such as box, cat, and pig. There are six different ways to play, including rhyming, where the box must match with the fox, or the bug with the rug, etc. The different play objectives allow for greater variation in the learning experience. The game claims to be rated for ages 3 and up.

37406.name: Power Checkers
37406.description:
Power Checkers is an expansion of the traditional game of Checkers. Game play is similar to the original game with the same movement, jumping, and kinging rules. The major difference comes in the expanded board, which allows for more maneuverability and the ability for special "Power" moves.

Players start with their pieces in special territories outside of the regular 8x8 board. To get Power Checker status, the player must get his or her piece all the way through the opponent's home territory to special Power spaces. Once there, the piece may move in any direction, transport to special Power Space Courts outside of the normal play area, and return to their home area.

The game is playable with 2-4 single players or team play.

37407.name: Campaign
37407.description: Campaign (also known as "Buck 20") is a simplified version of Chess, designed to be a good introductory game, easier to teach and to learn. The board size is reduced to 5x7. There are no knights or queens, nor are there "en passant" captures. The medieval piece names have been replaced with modern political terms: candidate, bodyguard, handler, and intern. Coins are used for playing pieces: one player plays heads and the other plays tails. For a more tense game, play for keeps.

37408.name: Snapz
37408.description:
(From back of box)

SNAPZ is a fast action family game for 2 to 4 players or teams. It requires the electronic SNAPZ umpire and the category and alphabet cards provided. The random interaction of these cards produce thousands of possible answers to the simple questions posed, (for example: give a name beginning with the letter for the category shown). But watch out!, at any time the game can increase in speed with the MIME TIME cards - momentarily turning the game into a fast and furious round of charades. The aim is to get rid of all of your cards by placing them back on the SNAPS unit or to an opposing player.

37409.name: Serpentine
37409.description:
Serpentine ... a 2, 3, or 4-player abstract strategy family board game.

The board consists of streamers with missing intersections and played with 84 tokens, in 4 colours, that are 2-sided with a straight streamer on one side and a curved streamer on the reverse.
In turn, players place their colour tokens on these spaces.

The goal is to form the longest possible same-colour Serpentine streamer.

The game has 3 levels of play:
Level 1 – in turn, players place one of their tokens on an empty space - and the turn is over. When the board is full or there are no more tokens to be placed, in order to form the longest possible streamer, on their next turn, players rotate or invert one of their own tokens in place.

Level 2 – players place one of their tokens on an empty space. During the same turn, a player may either:
1) Rotate or invert an opponent’s token without breaking a continuous streamer.
2) Move one of their own colour tokens to an empty space, thereby possibly breaking their own streamer.

Level 2 – players take these actions in the following order:
1) Place one of their tokens on an empty space.
2) Move any one of the opponent’s tokens to an adjacent empty space without rotating or inverting it.
3) Move any one of their tokens to an empty space on the board without rotating or inverting it ~ or, rotate or invert one of their own tokens in place.

The player with the longest continuous Serpentine streamer is the winner.

37410.name: Las Vegas Fortune
37410.description:
Monopoly clone with Las Vegas gambling elements added.

From the publisher's website:

Competition is tough on Las Vegas Boulevard, and it will take a lot more than luck to build your fortune in this town. This game has all the action of a traditional property trading game, with an exciting NEW poker twist where players build their fortune interacting with each other playing blackjack, roulette & dice games. Plus race against each other, to buy and develop your Casino and Resort properties. Who knows you might even hit the jackpot! The wealthiest gambler at the end of the game wins!!

37411.name: Marée noire
37411.description:
Contents : a wooden board with 62 holes, 62 wooden pawns with one side coloured blue, the other side black, 126 letters, two 8 pieces puzzles representing a whale and a sinking tanker .
The winner is he who has completed first his puzzle. The pawns are played with the same rules that Othello, and when a player surrounds at least 3 pawns, he gets the right to set one piece of his puzzle.

37412.name: Barbaria
37412.description:
Barbaria represents the history of the west (Europe, N. Africa, Near East) from the fall of the Roman Empire through the Mongol invasion, 406-1250 AD.

Players control several nations (Britannia-like) with differing objectives.

There are two versions using the same map, one using picture-dice combat, 6 turns, 90 minutes, one more detailed and using battle cards (no dice), 11 turns, up to 180 minutes.

In both cases the point scoring is much simplified from Britannia--one 8.5 by 11 inch sheet shows all scoring and appearance, no "nation cards" needed.

37413.name: Makin' Movies
37413.description:
MAKIN' MOVIES is a card game about collecting the right actors and money to make a movie.

You are a low budget movie producer and your goal is to compete against other
players to be the first to collect enough money and the right actors to make your
movie. Use your money to protect your actors from other players, or hire their
actors! It's a simple card game with many options and different ways to win.
Each turn every player has 3 actions which represent; Holding auditions, casting
for roles in your movie and hiring actors from other players.

The game concludes with the winning player naming their movie or giving a quick
advertisement trailer for their movie based on the strange collection of actors
they have hired.

The FREE Print and Play game contains 44 actor cards, 12 money cards, 8 scripts.

Retail Version contains 50 actors, 12 money cards, and 10 scripts.

37414.name: Superman
37414.description:
Roll-and-Move game where each player controls a superman pawn.

Object of the Game: Be the first player to bring your Villain to Jail and disarm his Secret Weapon at the Crime Lab.

Each player moves around the board uncovering question mark tokens in the hopes of finding the appropriate villain. Once found, they put the villain into the holder on their pawn and take him to jail.

After depositing the villains in jail, each player must find and disarm their secret weapon. The first player to disarm their secret weapon (by spinning an even number while the weapon is in their possession) wins.

37415.name: Usuthu!: Guerre Anglo-zoulou 1879
37415.description:
An easy to play free DTP wargame based on a battle between British and Zulu forces.

A quite unusual subject for a wargame, a battle in 1879 during the war between the British and the Zulus, but featuring some very simple and common mechanisms.

Historically, the Zulus benefited from the imprudence of the British leaders to win the Usuthu battle. Thanks to that imprudence the Zulus forces seized a whole convoy of food and ammunition and, more than that, were informed of British strategic intentions.

The link to this free DTP : http://www.frogofwar.org/?Telechargement:Errata

37416.name: Dig & Play Treasure Island
37416.description:
Gameplay is composed of two phases.

Initially, the game parts must be physically dug out of a block of plaster. This takes the theme (digging for buried treasure) and puts players to the act of literally digging their way through to actual treasure. This is a one-time-event only, although it may take a few hours to fully accomplish.

Next, once the parts have been recovered, players use pieces to move around a pirate's treasure map. This is a basically simple map, and may only hold the attention of children if they have actually dug the pieces out themselves, and may then appreciate the effort involved.

37417.name: Zahlen Ritter: Spiel um Burgen und Punkte
37417.description:
Zahlen Ritter is a two player game published in Switzerland by Max Giezendanner.
The game contains
24 tiles of each color (blue and red)
2 wooden pawns
2 wooden towers (score markers)
1 board
(the rules a printed in the box)

The players place alternately their tiles face down on the board and start at the score of 50 points.
The aim of the game is to grab all tiles of your opponent.
You get points when grabbing these and loose points when getting your own tiles.
Each tile is indicating the number of points you win or loose.

Each player also has 4 additional tiles with a treasure chest, lady, dragon, and a ghost worth respectively 20, 10, 10, 10 points when getting your opponents tiles or losing the same amount when drawing your own tiles.

37418.name: Tetrade
37418.description: Tetrade is a three dimensional boardgame on a triangular board with six holes on each side. Players put spheres in alternate turns and try to occupy the four corners of a tetrahedron with the size of 2,3,4,5 or 6 elements. Three spheres of lower level carry one sphere of higher level. A player succeeding in forming a tetrahedron receives a sphere from the hand of the opponent, so that this player is stalemated at the end of the game.

37419.name: Quarks
37419.description: Quarks is played on a 7x7-grid with one player ruling the transparent pieces and the other the solid ones. Both players try to form a column containing all elementary colors with one captured piece at the bottom and two friendly ones in the remaining colors. The first player who forms three of those Quarks wins the game.

37420.name: Sixon
37420.description: Sixon is played on a hexagonal board with five elements on each side, both players trying to reduce the hostile side to less than three. A piece is captured when standing on a cell threatened by three enemy pieces forming a triangle. Pieces may move over the edges of the board when turning their direction in an acute-angled way.

37421.name: Triade
37421.description:
Triade is a positional game played on a hexagonal board with four
elements on each side. Players try to form triangles of any size which reduces the hostile sides position. Pieces may move overboard when changing their direction.

37422.name: Het Finlandspel
37422.description:
(from the rulebook, translated from Dutch)
"The Finland game is a boardgame for 2-4 players, where every player can learn about the possibilities of Finland as a holiday destination by doing a tour of Finland."

Depending on the desired game length players get a number of cards corresponding with destinations on the board which have to be reached by moving the player's pawn across the board. There are also additional cards which the players can get by standing on yellow spaces on the board which give players additional destinations to visit or the possibility to e.g. use air travel to move faster. The game ends as soon as a player has no destination cards left in his hand.

Het Finlandspel is a promotional game distributed by travel agencies in the Netherlands in the early 1990s.

37423.description:
(from back of the box, translated from Dutch)
"Test your knowledge of our language! A box full of spelling questions and a box full of word knowledge questions. Thousands of difficulties. As player you always choose the level on which you want to play. And...every player can win! Collect three dictionaries and "click" them onto your pawn! Play on safe (green), play with some guts (blue), or are your ready to face a red question? Who challenges whom? Never was "educational" this much fun! So exciting! And of course: the name Van Dale guarantees high quality"

Het groot van Dale spel der Nederlandse taal is a word game based on the major dictionary of the Dutch language. It consists of a board over which the players move their pawns, answering questions pertaining to the Dutch language, in the fields of word knowledge and spelling. Correct answers earn dictionary markers which are put under the pawn. Depending on whether a player has one, two or three dictionaries, the questions become increasingly difficult, making the end game a challenge. The game ends when a player reaches the finish space on the board while having three dictionary markers.

This game is the same as Das grosse Dudenspiel and Oxford: the Great Oxford Game of the English Language, but in Dutch.
37423.name: Het Groot Van Dale Spel der Nederlandse Taal
boardgameexpansion: Het Groot Van Dale Spel der Nederlandse Taal: Etymologie
Het Groot Van Dale Spel der Nederlandse Taal: Spreekwoorden en Gezegden
Het Groot Van Dale Spel der Nederlandse Taal: Welk Woord?

37424.name: Jok-Lob
37424.description: This is a simulation of a tennis game. Player throws special dice to serve, then his opponent directly hit the ball back if he is in the right place, or else uses a card to see if he can reach the shot, and so on.

37425.name: Smart Girls Trivia
37425.description:
Have fun with your cool friends while playing this action packed internet board game. Answer questions about the things that interest girls the most – fashion, make-up, movies, music, sport and much more. Dare you share your innermost secrets with your friends – if not then pay the penalty! Have fun whilst acting out the craziest of charades or play the word chase game. Land on the internet square and log in to play the game with your friends on the internet. Publish your own trivia questions on the internet for other game players to share.

Online play available.

37426.description:
From the designer's website:

Sinyavino Offensive covers the "crossfire" offensive conducted by the Soviet forces in August, 1942. Crossfire, for it was a daring offensive from two opposite directions focused on a single objective: to free the isolated forces and people of Leningrad before the Germans conducted their own operation to seize the city! The bottleneck area held by German forces was no more than a few miles wide and defended by no more than three divisions. From the East, the Soviets would toss a total of 14 divisions and 100 tanks to smash the Nazi. From the West, across the Neva River, another 2-3 divisions and a tank brigade would conduct an amphibious assault. The battle would last over 30 days and desperate for both sides. At first, Red forces seriously broke through, forcing Hitler to cancel his own offensive to seize Leningrad and divert General Mainstein's forces to save the impending disaster. The battle was also the debut for Germany's new AFV, the Tiger tank!

Contains:
• 11" x 17" map
• 280 counters
• 11 page rules
• 2 page Player aid
37426.name: Sinyavino 1942

37427.name: Yami
37427.description:
This is a funny mixture of Rami and Yams, played with four sets of 32 cards. Players try to improve their hands in order to mark points upon their counting boards. Values give less reward than combinations, but allow access to bonus. After 16 rounds, he who has most points wins.

Reimplemented by:

Yamy

37428.name: Gargoyles the Movie Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 33: Gargoyles VHS Board Game
37428.description:
Bonus game included with the VHS and Laser Disc release of Gargoyles the Movie: The Heroes Awaken (a compilation of the first five episodes).

Components included: game board, "Building" cards, Demona "Wild" cards, Elisa "Badge" cards, spinner (1, 2, 3), and four player tokens (Goliath, Brooklyn, Lexington, Broadway).

Players were instructed to keep the video running after they finished watching the movie. The video would occasionally flash, and the player whose turn it was would have to follow the orders of the character (Xanatos, Elisa, or Demona) that appeared on screen.

37429.description:
The Typhon Promotion is a mini-expansion for StarCraft: The Board Game. It consists of a single planet, named Typhon, and the cards and tokens needed to use that planet in the game. The planet is special in that it has only a single connection point, while all the planets in the base game have at least two.

The Typhon Promotion was distributed among the visitors of the 2008 Blizzard Entertainment Worldwide Invitational, as part of a gift-bag containing several Blizzard-related goodies.

Expands:

StarCraft: The Board Game
37429.name: StarCraft: Typhon Promotion

37430.name: New World Disorder: Zombie Apocalypse!
37430.description:
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE! adds bloodthirsty zombies to your New World Disorder (2E) games. Pit swarms of zombies against existing crews, but pay heed--your fallen comrades will rise and turn on you when least expected. Even loot cars and other areas for lost and hidden gear.

Available in PDF format, and as a Printed Set with full-color paper miniatures and cardboard counters.

Expands:

New World Disorder (2E)

37431.description:
WARCOSM is an easy-to-learn and quick-paced tabletop game that simulates fleet-based space battles using either miniatures or flat counters.

Maneuver the enemy so that you can bring more weapons to bear on them. Find an enemy craft’s weaknesses to maximize the effectiveness of your attacks. Warcosm’s game mechanics encourage such tactics without overwhelming you with endless rules. This permits each player to control six, ten, or even a few dozen ships for scalable battles. Once you get the hang of the rules with the included battle scenarios, use the ship construction rules to build your own fleets. Decide how to arm your ships, the degree and types of hull protection, the power of drive systems, and whether or not to equip them with a number of other subsystems. The fate of the galaxy is in your hands. Command your fleets and lead them to Victory in the Stars.

Available in PDF format, and as a Printed Starter Set with hex-grid sheets, cardboard counters, ready-to-use fleet rosters, and 10-sided die.
37431.name: Warcosm

37432.name: Bitwa na Morzu Wiatrów
37432.description:
Bitwa na Morzu Wiatrów ("Battle of the Sea of Winds") is a nautical wargame set in about XVII century however with no historical scenario. Each player (green and red) owns an identical set of 10 ships varying number of man and guns on the deck. Task of the game is to reach the enemy harbor with the transport ship (without the guns).

Both the wind direction and the battles between ships are resolved using card decks. During the battle each player draws a card which determines the result of gunfire or boarding. There are several damages the ships can receive - the damaged sails, the lost sails, the lost sails and 1 or 2 guns and the fire.

The game was edited in Poland in the mid-eighties.

37433.name: Office Dodger
37433.description:
Bluffing card game about white collar workers fooling around at work.
One player is designated as the boss and the rest as workers. Each turn, workers choose a card representing their slacking (for points). Then the boss chooses one of those cards to flip over. If you are caught slacking you get no points and may even swap rolls with the boss. If the boss does not choose you, then you will get 1 or 2 points. The winner is he or she that makes 15 points first.

37434.name: Super Heat Surf Card Game
37434.description:
For two to six people, all ages. Experience the thrill of competitive surf action any time, anywhere! Compete for the most points to win. Easy to learn. Great to trade and collect.

Each 104 card deck has six character cards and 12 manoeuvre cards for each player, plus bonus point and penalty cards.

37435.name: Super Heat Skate Card Game
37435.description:
For two to six people, all ages. Experience the thrill of competitive skater action any time, anywhere! Compete for the most points to win. Easy to learn. Great to trade and collect.

Each 104 card deck has six character cards and 12 manoeuvre cards for each player, plus bonus point and penalty cards.

37436.name: Score Dr. J. Basketball Game
37436.description: Score Dr. J Basketball Game is an action game that features pictures of Julius Erving on the cover. The game has a shooting device that allows you to try and score baskets from anyplace on the court. The degree of difficulty of the shot determines what value is attached to the basket.

37437.name: Hotel Checkout
37437.description:
Translated from the publisher's site:

Going down? Collect the most tips by bringing down all your suitcases to the hotel reception. Every player want the lift to stop at floors suitable to them and load their suitcases to the lift.

Move the lift up or down by throwing the dice. If the lift stops at the right floor but is already full of suitcases, a suitcase has to be unloaded.

When you have loaded three of your own suitcases to the lift, you can bring it down to the reception. The player who is the first to bring down his/her 25 suitcases wins the game.

A fun family game full of excitement!

37438.name: Stymie
37438.description: Stymie is one of the games in the "Quickles" set produced by Ashburn Industries in the late 1970s. Using a modified standard deck - cards numbered 1-12 in four suits, plus six wild cards - players add to a central sum, trying to avoid pushing it over 100. Players then score points, with the objective of the players also being to avoid going over 100 (or reaching 0, from an initial score of 50).

37439.name: Hexad
37439.description: Hexad is one of the games in the "Quickles" set produced by Ashburn Industries in the late 1970s. Using a modified standard deck - cards numbered 1-12 in four suits, plus six wild cards - players attempt to reach the total given in the center first by using addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and the numbers in their hands. An advanced variant is offered wherein 2s can be used for square roots, 3s for cube roots, and so on.

37440.name: Travel Bingo
37440.description:
Travel Bingo comes with ten dice featuring objects that might be seen while driving, such as animals, vehicles, and buildings. Players roll the dice into the included tray, and then try to spot the objects for points. Before rolling, one die is set aside to customize the game to the players' location. (For example, the orange die has farm-related objects, so it is set aside if the players are in a town or city.)

The game is designed for a single player or multiple players working cooperatively, but includes rules for playing competitively with multiple sets.

37441.name: Pala
37441.description:
In the trick-taking card game Pala, players are art students who are learning to mix their pigments on the palette to get the right color for their canvases. The cards are the paint colors, and the palette is the table. By playing cards together (that is, mixing colors), you can effectively change the color of your cards as well as the trick itself.

The published version of Pala includes two ways to play. Both variants use the same mechanisms for playing tricks, but have different bidding and score rules. Thus, once you wrap your head around the basics of the game, you can play two wildly different games with those core rules.


In Impressionism, players collectively determine the value of different colors (suits) by discarding cards from their hands before the round begins. Points are bad, analogous to Hearts.



In Pointillism, players bid with colored chips to indicate the colors they expect to win, but over-bidding risks losing all your points for the round. Points are good, analogous to Spades.

37442.name: Stock Market
37442.description:
Stock Market game simulating the real stock market.

Parts:

One game board
6 markers - in the shape of small ticker tape machines
1 pair of dice
16 Good Tip cards
16 Bad Tip cards
16 Good News cards
16 Bad News cards
32 stock certificates for made up companies
Paper money totaling $1 billion

Winning the Game: To be the first player to gain outright and complete ownership of all the certificates in 4 different companies.

37443.name: Vaeva
37443.description:
Contents: a 20×20 board, 9 squared orange pawns and 9 squared yellow pawns, a rectangular platform 4×2.

The platform is set in the centre of the board, and the players try to access it. Pawns can move aside diagonally or jump over others. Some moves depend of the number of pawns upon the platform, which can also be moved. He who have put 5 pawns upon the platform wins the game.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
37444.description:
In The Big Time!, players take the role of theater owners in Chicago during the Golden Age of vaudeville from about 1905 to about 1915. The object is to make your theater the most spectacular in the city by booking the greatest and most diverse roster of acts that you can find (and afford!).

You win the game by having the highest score on the Success Track, which represents public approbation and goodwill. While money is an important part of running a successful theater, there've gotta be easier ways to make a living than dealing with a never-ending procession of ventriloquists, jugglers, and trained animals! No, you're in this business because greasepaint is in your blood, and you can't imagine a world without limelight.

In each of four turns, players bid on the right to select acts first and place those acts in their theaters. After your theaters are booked, you tally up scores to see who was the most successful. Good shows will drive up the reputation of your theater and influence the popularity of the types of acts that you book, but a flop can always set you back!
37444.name: The Big Time!
boardgamepodcastepisode: 21 Game Salute - Episode 17

37445.name: Trollball "this is not a fair game"
37445.description:
Based on the original Trollball game from Greg Stafford, this new game has been published (with Greg Stafford's authorization) as a fund raiser for the Tentacles convention(May 2008).

This is a violent fantasy sport simulation. The game comes with a 120x60 cm color board, color counters, card board miniatures, player statistics sheets and a 20-page rule booklet.

The game is simple and fast and best played with 5 players, one being the giant referee.

100 copies of the game were produced, with 90 to be sold, numbered 1 to 90 and 10 for people who were involved in the game (drawer, play testers, Greg Stafford, etc.).

37446.name: Hinguere
37446.description:
Two player abstract strategy boardgame with very simple set of rules, but hours of fun gaming. Easy to learn.

Black and white players take turns to place tiles according three rules and tries to make other player into the position, which is impossible to continue.

It can be played on a standard 8x8 chessboard, but smaller and bigger boards are possible. The size of the board will affect the difficulty and length of the game and also the winning tactics and strategies.

37447.name: New Parlor Game: The Path to Matrimony
37447.description:
Game board has decoration of a maze with arrows which either allow players to move backward or forward. Considering the age of the game, a spinner was most likely used for movement. The center of the board one lands on "The Alter."

W.J. Morgan & Co. operated in Cleveland Ohio from 1871-1908. It was a lithography firm that produced trade cards and advertising posters for sewing machines, stoves, medicines and petroleum.

37448.name: Go On or The Run for the Stake
37448.description: Game board is in a circular pattern where a person goes from circle to circle trying to get to the "Stake" first. Board does not have a maker's mark, but it is similar to McLoughlin Brothers boards. The date on it is copyright Jan. 1884. Wonderful printing lithographed colors.

37449.name: Stepping Stones of Life
37449.description:
Game where players strive to become the President of a business. Pitfalls along the way include a late train, missed street car, arrested, late for work etc. Four corners of the board have a Home, Hotel, Hospital and Court.

Pieces include:

gameboard
4 different colored metal figures
game spinner showing how many spaces to move

The games purpose is to promote good work habits and characteristics which lead to success

37450.name: The Game of Bamboozle or the Enchanted Isle
37450.description: This was one of the first large folding board games produced by Milton Bradley. Game board has a wonderfully lithographed fantasy land where one takes paths to get to the Enchanted Isle. The center of the board has two castle, woods, bears, a tent, a windmill and a church. The paths weave along the outside and into the center. The paths along the outside represent water and has pictures of a steamboat, canoeist, serpent, and whale. The four corners of board are one city scene, one house scene, one mermaid and one lighthouse. This particular version, with a plain box (likely considered "deluxe" at that time) is later than the first 1876 version, which probably featured a more decorative printed image on the box cover. This version probably dates from around 1900.

37451.name: Rock the Casbah
37451.description:
From the publisher:
Rock the Casbah
Military Operations in Urban Terrain, Peacekeeping Operations, the PLO, IDF, Syria, Christian Phalange, all are there in this superb supplement for Troops, Weapons & Tactics by Chris Stoesen. Ninety four pages long, this supplement covers an overview of the conflict in the Lebanon, looking at several sample battles from the early 1980s, including the siege of Beirut. TO&E and force generation systems are there for all of the main participants along with scenarios for some of the conflict's most high profile battles. Fancy taking on the IDF with Syrian tank hunter teams, defend your home with the Christian militias, fight the invaders with a mad mullah, it's all there in this fantastic new supplement. Available for just £6 in pdf format this is a superb guide that provides a great backdrop for any modern peacekeeping or counter-insurgency operation, from Iraq to Afghanistan, from Sierra Leone to Chechenya.

Expands:

Troops, Weapons & Tactics

37452.name: Finest Hour
37452.description:
From the publisher:

Finest Hour
A complete Battle of Britain supplement for Bag the Hun, including full details on the squadrons that took part, mechanisms for generating pilots, squadrons, and scenarios. A comprehensive section looks at the tactics of the conflict, as well as providing full details on where units were based during the conflict. Finest Hour allows the gamer to re-fight the entire Battle of Britain day-by-day, for his pilots to develop and gain experience and even awards for their flying exploits.

37453.name: Olipa kerran ihminen -lautapeli
37453.description:
Back of the box (translated):

"Once Upon A Time Man" is an exciting trivia and task game for schoolchildren, adolescents and adults. Test your knowledge of the history of mankind and win the fabulous race through millennia from the Big Bang all the way to the launch of the Space Rocket.

The game includes 1300 different history questions and tasks in two levels of difficulty. This makes the game playable to everyone able to read.

Included is a DVD with full episodes of Albert Barillé's animated series "Once Upon A Time Man", "Once Upon A Time Life" and "Once Upon A Time Space".

37454.name: Maisy's alphabet card game
37454.description:
a set of 52 cards 26 capital and 26 lower case.

From the back of the box:

There are lots of games to play with these colorful Maisy alphabet cards -

Identify the letter and name the picture
Put the the cards in alphabetical order
Spell simple words
Play a memory game
there are lots of possibilities




All the while, children learn the alphabet and build their vocabulary.

37455.description:
It represents the fight between Arab and Israeli in the front of Sinai, during the Yom Kippur war, 1973.
Map 297x420mm and 96 counters.

Game included with Alea Magazine nº3.
37455.name: Yom-Kippur, Sinai-73

37456.description:
The game simulates the combats of the valley Ia Drang of October and November of 1965.

Game included with Alea Magazine nº5.
37456.name: Ia Drang-Zona X-Rae

37457.name: GameVault 2050
37457.description:
Players take the role of computer hackers, wandering the board in an attempt to download game designs and smuggle them off the network.
The game was published August 13, 2004 in Pyramid Magazine. Because of the restructuring of Pyramid, it is no longer available.
Sample:
http://www.sjgames.com/pyramid/sample.html?id=4904

37458.name: Five Card Baseball
37458.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Real baseball situations are implemented into the game to make it as real as it can get. The game is for one or two players Ages 8 and up. Five Card Baseball is played with a 60 card deck. Flip the cards and watch the game unfold like magic. Witness your opponent walk to first base, steal second and score on a single as you watch helplessly. Defeat your opponent in a realistic 9 inning game. Five Card Baseball can also be played with two or more decks for a more interesting experience."

The game is for one or two players and involves revealing cards to simulate situations in a baseball game.

37459.name: Pleasure Island
37459.description:
From the box:

Players move their game tokens through the tropical Island full of romance and passion. Each square holds its own adventure. As your tokens land on the squares, you and your lover must perform the activities listed. If a player lands on either a Pleasure Chest or a Prisoner of a love square, he or she must draw a card from the corresponding card pile and perform the activity listed on the card. Once the activity is completed , the card is returned to the bottom of the deck and play continues. The player that completes the game first, by landing on the "X", can choose to keep the game going by selecting two cards from each pile and performing the activities.

Contents: 2 Game Tokens, 1 Game Die, 22 Pleasure Chest Cards, 22 Prisoner of Love Cards & 1 Game Board

37460.description:
Sandbox hill is a miniatures wargame that uses plastic army men as soldiers and die-cast metal cars as tanks and can be played in about any location.

The game requires you supply:

Soldiers: at least 60 army men preferably in two colors
Tanks: at least 6 die cast metal cars (hot-wheels, matchbox, etc)
Artillery: several hundred large rubber bands
Mines: a hand full of quarters (or equivalent coins)
The Injurator: One large pair of scissors
The Mauler: One large hammer
The Moverator: A piece of string twelve inches long.
The Rangefinder: A standard twelve inch ruler.
The Iron Dice: One or two six-sided dice.
Eye Preserver: Two pairs of safety goggles




In the game players take turns activating 5 soldiers or tanks, most can move and shoot on turn but there are a variety of different troop types with some special abilities modifying this. Dexterity based rubber band flicks are used for ranged combat and die rolling for close combat. Damage is represented by either a die roll that tells what part of the infantry figure to cut off with The Injurator (large scissor) or for tanks a blow with The Mauler (large hammer)

The game rules are available for free download as a full color PDF from http://www.animalball.com/games.html
37460.name: Sandbox Hill

boardgamehonor: 2009 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Nominee
37461.description:
Krakow 1325 AD is a 4-player card game full of trickery, which interacts with a map board. The game was first presented to the boardgaming world at Spiel 08 in Essen (October 2008) in two versions - English and Dutch.

The setting is Krakow, capital of Medieval Poland. The players form into two teams of ruthless crooks, which compete for influence and riches through a card game using a deck of 56 special "Intrigue Cards". But below the surface, things get uglier: every player has a hidden Identity and secretly competes against all others, including his own teammate. And there can be only one winner at game end...

The game comprises a mapboard, a card set of 56 Intrigue and 8 Special Cards, 4 Treasury boxes, 110 wooden Influence Tokens and 10 Victory Point/Turn markers.

Krakow 1325 AD is a game of strategy and trickery, overloaded with original artwork and a warped sense of humour.

In October 2009, a 3-player expansion to Krakow 1325 AD was published (English/Dutch and German versions).

The game can be ordered directly from the designer/publisher by sending a private mail through Boardgamegeek.
37461.name: Kraków 1325 AD

37462.name: Tamerlane Chess
37462.description:
Tamerlane Chess is a strategic board game related to chess and shatranj. It was developed in Persia and was favored by the 14th century Turco-Mongol conqueror Timur the Lame (also known as "Tamerlane"), who thought regular chess was not complex enough.

The board consists of a 10 by 11 unchecked pattern along with extra squares are called citadels. This version of chess has multiple types of pawn, and each one promotes itself in different way.

The playing pieces include the king, the general, the vizir, the giraffe, the picket, the knight, the rook, the elephant, the camel, the war engine, and pawns.

37463.description:
Second game in the battle of the middle ages series, on one of the most famous battle of all the Baltic region history, immortalized by Eisenstein Alexander Nevskji
It uses a chit activation system and a partially randomized method of combat resolution (ie, units are rated for level, but the real strength of the unit is discovered only when it comes to fight for the first time).

Contains:
11 x 17" full color map (2 - 8.5 x 11" parts)
216 counters
Rules in English

Available for print & play download through www.wargamedownloads.com and
www.arima.it

Also available in printed version through Boulder Games and Noble Knight Games
37463.name: Battles of the Middle Ages: Lake Peipus
boardgamefamily: TCS Battles of the Middle Ages System

37464.name: American Pie
37464.description:
American Pie is a simple card game for 3-5 players, excellent for family play. Each player is a cook trying to make good cakes (there 6 different types of cakes in the basic game) and earn more victory points than opponents. To do so, he have to make a good recipe, an excellent bakery and avoid harm coming from Bears, Kittens and Best Friend'd Phone Call.
The final judge is grandma, so beware of what you cook!!

Around 90 full colour cards

Available as print & Play download through www.wargamedownloads.com
and www.arima.it

37465.name: Silly Sentences
37465.description:
Players complete sentences by placing jigsaw pieces with words on them from their hand.

The shape of the 124 puzzle pieces enforces correct grammar in the sentence, but the sentences can be very silly indeed such as "The furry clock ate the big princess." or "A blue crocodile jumped over the school."

All the pieces except the 40 nouns are dealt to players. The nouns are reserved in a stock for players to select one when they want/need to. A players hand goes down by one, except when they play a noun.

The winner is the one to get rid of all their words first. The strategy is therefore to block other players and force them to select nouns because they cannot play any other valid words.

Along the way a lot of fun is had by placing unexpected nouns in the sentences. Subtitled "grammar skills practice for the first three years of school", various classroom activities are also possible and included in the note to parents and teachers that accompanies the rules.

37466.description:
Battles of the American Civil War was the first expansion for the Volley & Bayonet "big battle" miniatures rules. While most of the rules for the American Civil War were given in the basic V&B rules, the BACW source book ties them together in a more cohesive set. The BACW book adds rules for multi-day battles and entrenchments, and adds a point system for constructing ad hoc balanced ACW battles.

A strategic game (heavily based on GDW "House Divided" rules) is included, allowing players to play a campaign game if they so desire.

Scenarios and orders of battle are included for:

Second Manassas
Antietam
Brandy Station
Gettysburg
Third Winchester
Shiloh
Stone's River (Murfreesboro)
Champion's Hill
Chickamauga
Franklin
37466.name: Battles of the American Civil War:  A Sourcebook for Volley & Bayonet

37467.name: Schlachtefest
37467.description: A children's game consisting of cardboard jigsaw pieces, which put together result in multi-coloured pigs. By rolling two dice on every turn, the players try to get the most completed pigs.

37469.name: oh no
37469.description: 1967 Twister variant with movable tiles instead of a static mat. Also a card deck. The game can be played in teams or as individuals.

37471.name: Don't Bite the Pavement
37471.description:
Don't Bite the Pavement is a game of quick-action reflexes and split second timing. The object of the game is to navigate one challenging obstacle after another until you reach the top of the obstacle course! See who can beat the course faster!

Two different rule variations.

37472.name: Staxx
37472.description:
Staxx is part of Ashburn Industries' "The Quickles" series of card games.

Staxx uses a modified standard deck of cards, with two letters on each card and 6 wilds (effectively the jokers and kings). Staxx combines a standard Rummy game with a word game; players score the most for runs and sets that form words, but can meld just words or sets/runs.

37473.description:
Different butterflies have to be placed on coloured flowers, trying to pair them with their same-coloured counterpart.

From the box:

A butterfly flutters by - and alights on a flower - it opens its wings... Will they be the same colour as the blue flower it is resting on? Hard luck! They're not!
Where then is the blue butterfly to match the blue flower?

A concentration and memory game for 2-6 players between Ages 5 - 8
37473.name: Schmetterlings-Spiel

37474.name: Zirkusspiel
37474.description: Moving in the circus, the players have to search for the animal species attendant related to their player role (Lions -> lion tamer). By memorizing the location of a players animal tiles and revealing them on his/her turn, the player can win.

37475.name: TV Mania
37475.description:
From The Website

TV Mania is the first totally television-based board game complete with interactive DVD, and the ultimate television history information.

It covers the most popular and best loved TV shows and TV stars we invited into our lounges every day and made part of our lives.

TV Mania is a celebration of television, incorporating celebrity bios, celebrity births and deaths, photos, the highest paid TV personalities, information, news & trivia from the Lone Ranger in 1949 and Superman in 1951, through to today with Desperate Housewives, Rove Live, Friends, Frasier, Home & Away, The Simpsons, Neighbours and 24.

So, take a trip down memory lane to the American, British, and Australian TV shows and stars you loved, and hated, over the years.

Home Page: http://www.tvmaniagame.com/index.php

37476.name: Ella Cinders
37476.description: This roll-and-move dice game was based upon a United Feature Syndicate comic strip that ran between 1925 and 1961. (There was also a 1926 silent movie based on the story.) As the name implies, the comic strip was based upon the tale of Cinderella. The game is considered to be very difficult to find.

boardgameimplementation: Who is going to do the dishes?
boardgamehonor: 2008 Japan Boardgame Prize Voters' Selection Nominee
37477.description:
It's quitting time at the office and everyone wants to go home. Unfortunately, there are still many jobs to finish tonight. It's a race to get out of the office first!
